23 state law reference fs ch 162 declaration of legislative intent it is the intent of this article to promote protect and improve the health safety and welfare of the citizens of lantana florida by providing an equitable expeditious effective and inexpensive method of enforcing the hereinafter described codes of the town state law reference similar provisions fs  16202  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning town council shall mean the legislative body of the town of lantana florida town attorney shall mean the legal counselors for the town of lantana florida clerk of the board shall mean the town clerk or any employee of the town so designated by the town administrator shall mean those authorized agents or employees of the municipality whose duty it is to insure code compliance enforcement board shall mean the lantana board  enforcement board  organization the town council shall appoint a sevenmember code enforcement board and legal counsel for the board alternatively the town council may appoint a special magistrate to hear code enforcement board cases references in this article to an enforcement board except as related to the appointment qualifications or composition of the actual enforcement board shall include a special magistrate if the context permits the members of the board shall have the following qualifications and terms of office 1 members of the enforcement board shall be residents of the town appointments shall be made by the town council on the basis of experience or interest in the subject matter jurisdiction of the code enforcement board the membership of the enforcement board shall whenever possible include an architect a businessman an engineer a general contractor a subcontractor and a realtor the town council may appoint two 2 alternates if desired 2 in addition to the qualifications set forth in 1 above each member of the enforcement board shall have the following minimum qualifications where appropriate a the architects and the engineers shall be registered under the state laws regulating the practice of architecture or engineering or shall possess similar qualifications under the laws of other states or shall have actual experience deemed by the town council to be equivalent to such registration  b the general contractors and the subcontractors shall possess a valid certificate of competency and occupational license recognized and accepted under the state laws and the ordinances of the city regulating the business of contracting and where required state registration as a contractor or shall possess similar qualifications under the laws of other states or shall have actual experience deemed by the town council to be equivalent to such certification  c the real estate persons shall be licensed under the state laws licensing real estate persons as either broker or salesman or shall possess similar qualifications under the laws of other states or shall have actual experience deemed by the town council to be equivalent to such licensing and shall hold a current and valid occupational license issued by the town  d the business persons shall be actively engaged in any lawful business within the town and shall hold a current and valid occupational license issued by the town or shall be an officer or employee of a business entity holding a current and valid occupational license issued by the town 3 all appointments shall be made for a term of three 3 years any members may be reappointed for one successive three 3 year term upon approval of the town council appointments to fill any vacancy on the enforcement board shall be for the remainder of the unexpired term of office any member who fails to attend two 2 of three 3 successive meetings without cause and without prior approval of the chairman shall automatically forfeit his appointment and the town council shall promptly fill such vacancy the members shall serve in accordance with the ordinances of the town and may be suspended and removed for cause as provided in fs   4 the members of the enforcement board shall elect a chairman and vicechairman the presence of four 4 or more members shall constitute a quorum of the enforcement board members shall serve without compensation but may be reimbursed for such travel expenses mileage expenses and per them expenses as may be authorized by the town manager and approved by the town council 5 the town attorney shall either act as counsel to the enforcement board or shall represent the town by presenting cases before the board but in no case shall the town attorney serve in both capacities should the town council appoint a special magistrate to hear code enforcement board cases the town attorney shall act as prosecutor for the town    112789   92412   12819 state law reference similar provisions fs  16205 enforcement procedure a it shall be the duty of the code inspectors to initiate enforcement proceedings of the various codes no member of the board shall have the power to initiate such enforcement proceedings b if a violation of the found the code inspector shall notify the violator and give the violator a reasonable time to correct the violation unless c or d of this section applies should the violation continue beyond the time specified for correction the code inspector shall notify the enforcement board and request a hearing pursuant to the procedures set forth in sections 250 and 251 herein or shall alternatively proceed to handle the case pursuant to section 259 herein notice shall be served upon the violator as provided herein section 257 c if the code inspector has reason to believe a violation presents a serious threat to the public health safety or welfare or if the violation is irreparable or irreversible in nature the code inspector shall make a reasonable effort to notify the violator and may immediately notify the enforcement board and request a hearing d if a repeat violation is found the code inspector shall notify the violator but is not required to give the violator a reasonable time to correct the violation the code inspector upon notifying the violator of a repeat violation shall notify the enforcement board and request a hearing the code enforcement board clerical staff shall schedule a hearing and shall provide notice as set forth herein the case may be presented to the enforcement board even if the repeat violation has been corrected prior to the board hearing and the notice shall so state      2 9886   112387   112789 hearings a the chairman of the enforcement board may call hearings of the enforcement board and hearings may also be called by written notice signed by at least three 3 members of the enforcement board the enforcement board at any hearing may set a future hearing date the enforcement board should attempt to convene no less frequently than once every two 2 months but may meet more or less often as the demand necessitates b minutes shall be kept of all hearings by the enforcement board and all hearings shall be open to the public the town clerks office shall provide clerical and administrative personnel as may be reasonably required by the enforcement board for the proper performance of its duties c each case before the enforcement board shall be presented by the local governing body attorney or by a member of the staff of the local governing body d the enforcement board shall proceed to hear the cases on the agenda for that day all testimony shall be under oath and shall be recorded the enforcement board shall take testimony from the code inspector and alleged violator e at the conclusion of the hearing the enforcement board shall issue findings of fact and conclusions of law and shall issue an order affording the proper relief consistent with powers granted herein the finding shall be by motion approved by a majority of those present and voting except that at least four 4 members of the enforcement board must vote in order for the action to be official    112387 state law reference similar provisions fs  16207 hearing procedures a no board member shall act in any case in which that member has a conflict of interest as discussed in fs b hearings shall be informal and need not be conducted according to technical rules relating to evidence and witnesses they shall however be conducted in accordance with accepted parliamentary procedures relative to motions votes and decisions fundamental due process shall be observed and shall govern all hearings c all relevant evidence shall be admitted if in the opinion of the board it is the type of evidence upon which reasonable and responsible persons would normally rely in the conduct of business affairs regardless of the existence of any common law or statutory rule which might make such evidence inadmissible over objections in civil actions the chairman of the board may exclude irrelevant or unduly repetitious evidence d hearsay evidence may be accepted for the purpose of supplementing or explaining any direct evidence but such hearsay evidence shall not in and of itself be considered sufficient to support a finding or decision unless the evidence would be admissible over objections in a civil action e each party to the hearing shall have the right to 1 call and examine witnesses  2 introduce exhibits  3 crossexamine opposing witnesses  4 impeach witnesses  5 rebut evidence f the alleged violator has the right to be represented by an attorney at the violation hearing af state law reference similar provisions fs  16208 power of board the board shall have the power to 1 adopt rules for the conduct of its hearings not otherwise in conflict with this article or the local government code enforcement boards act fs ch 162 as such now exist or may hereafter be amended  2 subpoena alleged violators and witnesses to its hearings  3 subpoena evidence to its hearings 4 take testimony under oath  5 issue orders having the force of law commanding whatever steps are necessary to bring a violation into compliance 6 reduce fines after compliance upon application to the board g   112789 state law reference similar provisions fs  16208 waiver of hearing the alleged violators may however if he so elects waive his right to a hearing and consent to the imposition of a fine after a stated period of time in which to comply the waiver shall be in writing on a form provided by the town signed by all violators named in the notice of violation and witnessed  subpoena powers and procedures the code inspectors the board or the alleged violator may request that witnesses records including surveys plats and other materials and other evidence be subpoenaed to any violation hearing subpoenas shall be served by the sheriff of the county or the police department of the town these subpoenas shall be available clerk of the enforcement board a nominal administrative fee shall be charged for the preparation and service of the subpoenas the amount of which administrative fee shall be established by resolution of the town council    9886   112387 fines the enforcement board upon notification by the code inspector that a previous order of the enforcement board has not been complied with by the set time may order the violator to pay a fine not to exceed two hundred fifty dollars $25000 for each day that the violation continues past the date set for compliance for a first violation and may order the violator to pay a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 for each day the violation continues past the date set forth for compliance for a repeat violation a certified copy of an order imposing a fine may be recorded in the public records and thereafter shall constitute a lien against the land on which the violation exists if the violator does not own the land the lien shall be upon any other real or personal property owned by the violator it may be enforced in the same manner as a court judgement including levy against the personal property after three 3 months from the date of filing of any such lien which remains unpaid the enforcement board may authorize the town attorney to foreclose on the lien no lien created pursuant to the provisions of this chapter may be foreclosed on real property which is a homestead under section 4 article x of the state constitution    112789 state law reference similar provisions fs  16209 appeal an aggrieved party including the local governing body may appeal a final administrative order of an enforcement board to the circuit court such an appeal shall not be a hearing de novo but shall be limited to appellate review of the record created before the enforcement board an appeal shall be filed within thirty 30 days of the execution of the order to be appealed    112387 state law reference similar provisions fs  16212 notices all notices must be provided to the alleged violator as follows 1 by certified mail return receipt requested to the address listed in the tax collectors office for tax notices or the address listed in the palm beach county property appraisers database additional notice may also be provided to any other address the town may find for the property owner  2 for property owned by a corporation notices may be provided by certified mail to the registered agent of the corporation  3 by hand delivery by the sheriff or other law enforcement officer code inspector or other person designated by the town  4 by leaving the notice at the violators usual place of residence with any person residing therein who is above the age of fifteen 15 years and informing such person of the contents of the notice  or 5 in the case of commercial premises leaving the notice with the manager or other person in charge 6 if any notice sent by certified mail is not signed as received within thirty 30 days after the postmarked date of mailing notice may be provided by posting as described hereinbelow 7 in addition to providing notices as set forth above at the option of the code enforcement board or special magistrate notice may also be served by publication or posting as follows a if publication is the method of notice to be utilized such notice shall be published once during each week of four 4 consecutive weeks four 4 publications being sufficient in a newspaper of general circulation in the county where the code enforcement board is located the newspaper shall meet the requirements as are prescribed under fs ch 50 as amended by legal and official advertisements b proof of publication shall be made as provided in fs   and  c in lieu of publication as described in paragraph a such notice may be posted for at least ten 10 days prior to the hearing or prior to the expiration of any deadline contained in the notice in at least two locations one 1 of which shall be the property upon which the violation is alleged to exist and the other of which shall be at lantana town hall d proof of posting shall be by affidavit of the person posting the notice which affidavit shall include a copy of the notice posted and the date and places of its posting 8 notice of publication or posting may run concurrently with or may follow an attempt or attempts to provide notice by hand delivery or by mail as required above 9 evidence that an attempt has been made to hand deliver or mail notice as provided above together with proof of publication or posting as provided herein shall be sufficient to show that the notice requirements of this section as set forth in conformance with fs ch 162 have been met without regard to whether or not the alleged violator actually received such notice    9886   112387   112789   92412   7813 state law reference similar provisions fs  16212 ex parte communications no ex parte communication relative to the merits threat or offer of reward shall be made to the board by any employee of the town or any party to the proceeding or any person who directly or indirectly would have a material interest in an action pending before the board or the authorized representative or counsel of any such party  alternate code enforcement procedures a issuance of citations a code enforcement officer is authorized to issue a citation to a person when based on personal investigation the officer has reasonable cause to believe that the person has committed a civil infraction in violation of a duly enacted code or ordinance and this citation will be heard by the county court b notice prior to issuing a citation a code enforcement officer shall provide notice to the person that has committed a violation of a code or ordinance and shall establish a reasonable time period within which the person must correct the violation such time period shall be no more than thirty 30 days if upon personal investigation a code enforcement officer finds that the person has not corrected the violation within the time period allowed the code enforcement officer may issue a citation to the person who has committed the violation if the code enforcement officer has reason to believe that the violation presents a serious threat to the public health safety or welfare or if the violation is irreparable or irreversible the code enforcement officer is not obligated to provide the person with a reasonable time period within which to correct the violation prior to the issuance of the citation c form of citation the citation issued by the code enforcement officer shall be in a form prescribed by the town and shall contain the following 1 the date and time of issuance 2 the name and address of the person to whom this citation is issued 3 the date and time the civil infraction was committed for the facts constituting reasonable cause 4 the number or section of the code or ordinance violated 5 the name and authority of the code enforcement officer 6 the procedure for the person to follow in order to pay the civil penalty or contest the citation 7 the applicable civil penalty if the person elects to contest the citation 8 the applicable civil penalty if the person elects not to contest the citation 9 a conspicuous statement if the person fails to pay the civil penalty within the time allowed or fails to appear in court to contest the citation he shall be deemed to have waived his right to contest the citation and that in such case judgement may be entered against the person for an amount up to the maximum civil penalty d disposition by county court after issuing a citation to an alleged violator a code enforcement officer shall deposit the original citation and one 1 copy of the citation with the county court for further disposition e certain ordinances lend themselves to be enforced by means of a citation method and as such the town has deemed the following sections of the code those to be enforced citation method and has provided a schedule of violations and penalties to be assessed as follows class i offense fine amount  $ 5000 aalcoholic beverages in public places fishing restricted public beach rules regulation upon receipt of a citation the person alleged to have violated the town request a court appearance the county court judge may assess a maximum civil penalty not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 if contested if the citation is not contested the amount of fine is the face value of the citation plus costs f   civil infraction all violations of the ordinances shall be considered as civil infractions with a maximum civil penalty not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 g citation contested  county court should any person receiving a citation desire to contest same such person shall have the right to appear in county court in order to present his case and have the determined position made by the court h failure to accept citation  misdemeanor any person who willfully refuses to sign and accept a citation issued by a code enforcement officer shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the second degree punishable as provided in section  or  florida statutes i citations not applicable to certain portions of building codes the provisions of this section shall not apply to the enforcement pursuant to section 55379 and 55380 of the building codes adopted pursuant to section 55373 as they apply to construction provided that a building permit is either not required or has been issued by the municipality for the purpose of this subsection building codes means only those codes adopted pursuant to section 55373 j provisions additional and supplemental the provisions of the section are additional and supplemental means of enforcing municipal codes and ordinances and may be used for the enforcement of any code or ordinance or for the enforcement of all codes and ordinances except as set forth herein above nothing contained in this section shall prohibit the town from enforcing its codes or ordinances by any other means  112789   81390   11392   1o2593 secs 2602100  reserved article v  reserved footnotes  5  editors note  adopted  repealed article v  21012107 which there is hereby created a municipal advisory board to be known as the greater lantana school community education council also informally known as the education council which shall consist of a maximum of eight 8 voting members and three 3 nonvoting exofficio members four 4 voting members shall constitute a quorum in order to conduct and vote upon any and all council business  32601   12802   6903   32805   82718 eligible members the eight 8 members of the greater lantana school community education council to be appointed by the town council as follows a six 6 residents of the town of lantana  b one 1 memberatlarge who is not a resident of the town  c one 1 member from the greater lantana chamber of commerce  d the principals from the three 3 schools are nonvoting exofficio members e additionally the town council may appoint one 1 member of the town council as a nonvoting liaison to the education council if desired  32601   12802   6903   32805   82718 residence requirement all members of the education council shall reside in the town except the member from the greater lantana chamber of commerce the memberatlarge as set forth in subsection 2111a above the members appointed by the towns of manalapan south palm beach and hypoluxo as set forth in subsection 2110b above the members representing the lantana public schools as set forth above at subsection 2111c and the nonvoting members set forth in subsections 2111d and e above  6903   32805 meetings the greater lantana school community education council shall meet on a semiannual basis but may meet more frequently if the town manager determines that a special meeting is necessary minutes must be recorded at every meeting all meetings shall conform to the requirements of fs known as government in the sunshine law and all documents generated or received by members of the council shall be subject to fs known as the public records act  32601   61013 term the members of the education council shall generally be appointed to threeyear terms  however in order that the terms will be staggered the members will be appointed as follows four 4 of the initial council members shall be appointed for a oneyear term  four 4 for a twoyear term  four 4 for a threeyear term  and the exofficio members and the memberatlarge shall each be appointed for a threeyear term thereafter all members shall be appointed to threeyear terms members and the exofficio members may be reappointed for successive terms  6903   32805 powers and duties the greater lantana school community education council shall have the following powers and duties a establish and amend bylaws from time to time to govern the councils business and election of officers from those appointed as set forth in section 2110  b represent the town of lantana and other constituents of the lantana public schools who do not reside in the town  c develop and build community partnerships with local business within the greater lantana area to assist with professional skills materials financial or education support for education  d monitor school board activities  e serve as a liaison between the school board of palm beach county and the town council  f participate in an exchange of information with all public school principals in lantana media  g develop recommendations to present to the town council for action on issues concerning the school board of palm beach county in support of schools in the greater lantana school community  h promote a positive image of the greater lantana area public relations media such as the internet and studentproduced web pages  i build community and parental involvement in the schools  j develop additional resources such as state and federal funding to support the schools  k provide school programs to benefit all students in partnerships with other community groups such as the greater lantana chamber of commerce real estate groups and other community groups in the greater lantana school community  and l address safety issues for students before after and during school  32601   32805 coordination with town the greater lantana school community education council shall be an advisory board to the town council  the actions decisions and recommendations of the council shall not be final or binding on the town council but shall constitute recommendations to the town council the education council shall periodically advise the town council of its recommendations with regard to issues and shall respond to any matter referred to it by the town council within such time as prescribed by the town council  32601 secs 21172120  reserved article vii  town of lantana ethics ordinance town ethics article a the intent of this article is to provide for the adoption of the palm beach county ethics by reference as the towns own ethics provisions and to authorize the jurisdiction of the palm beach county commission on ethics within the town of lantana so that these referenced county ethics regulations and the jurisdiction of the commission on ethics as such regulations or jurisdiction may be amended in the future by the county shall apply within the town of lantana b  the town of lantana adopts by reference and as its own the palm beach county ethics set forth in palm beach county at the following sections sections 2441   subsections 2444c d and e  and sections 2445 c the palm beach county commission on ethics as referenced in the palm beach county at division 8 in sections 2254 as these sections may be amended shall exercise jurisdiction in the town of lantana subject to the provisions for same as set forth in the interlocal agreement between the town and the county concerning the applicability of the countys ethics and the commission on ethics within the town of lantana d the palm beach county ethics and commission on ethics ordinances provisions set forth hereinabove in existence as of the effective date of this hereby incorporated by reference into the town ordinances and shall be kept on file in the office of the town clerk for reference purposes in addition a copy of the executed interlocal agreement between the town and the county concerning such ethics provisions shall also be kept on file in the office of the town clerk e all references to county government provided for in the palm beach county commission on ethics and ethics ordinances including but not limited to county elected and appointed officials county employees county divisions and departments shall be deemed as reference to the corresponding elected and appointed officers divisions and departments of the town of lantana as appropriate to effectuate the intent of this article  9272010 alcoholic beverages footnotes  1  cross reference   beaches boats waterways ch 5 off the following premises except during the hours specifically set forth in this section and stated below 1 nightclubs bars and lounges nightclubs bars and lounges may serve alcoholic beverages during the following hours a mondays alcoholic beverages may be sold from  am until  am the following morning b sundays alcoholic beverages may be sold from  pm noon until  am the following morning 2 establishments other than nightclubs bars and lounges a sundays alcoholic beverages may be sold from  am until  am the following morning except packaged goods for consumption offpremises ie at grocery stores package stores and similar establishments which may be sold from  am until  am the following morning b on days of the week other than sunday alcoholic beverages may be sold from  am until  am  56214l 562452 reserved editors note  adopted feb 28 201 repealed  33 which pertained to exceptions to location restrictions and derived from the  alcoholic beverages in public places a it shall be unlawful for any person to possess any open containers or consume any alcoholic beverages on any public street sidewalk rightofway park beach or upon the premises of a retail establishment while outside the confines of the structure on such premises when the main use of the establishment is the sale of alcoholic beverages or upon any parking lot or driveway on any business industrial or institutional property where the public has a right to travel  while expressly exempting from the prohibition stated hereinabove any sale andor consumption of beer and wine only on townowned or other property during special event functions which occur within the confines of the area designated by the special events permit granted by the town specifically allowing such sale andor consumption pursuant to section 1125 or 11251 b it shall be unlawful for any person to possess any open container of or consume any alcoholic beverages in or on a motor vehicle being operated on or parked on any public street rightofway park beach or any parking lot or driveway on any business industrial or institutional property or any public area open for vehicular traffic c possession of an open container of any alcoholic beverage shall not be unlawful in the following instances 1 when any person is picking up empty containers in an effort to control litter  2 when any licensed vendor or distributor of alcoholic beverages is transporting beverages solely for commercial purposes  3 when the open container is not readily accessible to the driver or passengers as in a trunk or locked glove compartment of a vehicle  4 when the transportation of any open container or consumption of alcoholic beverage shall take place in or on any motor vehicle duly licensed and operated for hire to transport passengers such as charter buses regularly scheduled buses taxicabs and the separate passenger compartments of limousines  provided that the operator is not in immediate possession of an open container of any alcoholic beverage nor engaged in the consumption of any alcoholic beverage 5 when any person is in attendance and within the confines of the area for which a special events permit has been issued by the town allowing the sale andor consumption of beer and wine only during such special event d any person found in violation of the provisions of this section shall be issued a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000    51286   42301 editors note  adopted  did not specifically amend this   hence codification of the substantive provisions of the ordinance as  34 was at the editors discretion cross reference streets sidewalks and other public places ch 17 forfeiture of vehicles and apparatus any vehicle vessel aircraft or any animal used in the transportation or removal of or for the deposit or concealment of any illicit liquor still or stilling apparatus or any mash or other fermented liquids capable of being distilled or manufactured into alcoholic beverages where for sale a it shall be unlawful for any person maintaining owning or operating a commercial establishment located within the town at which alcoholic beverages are offered for sale for consumption on the premises 1 to suffer or permit any female person while on the premises of the commercial establishment to expose to the public view that area of the human breast at or below the areola thereof 2 to suffer or permit any female person while on the premises of the commercial establishment to employ any device or covering which is intended to give the appearance of or simulate such portions of the human female breast as described in 1 above 3 to suffer or permit any person while on the premises of the commercial establishment to expose to public view his or her genitals pubic area buttocks anus or anal cleft or cleavage 4 to suffer or permit any person while on the premises of the commercial establishment to employ any device or covering which is intended to give the appearance of or simulate the genitals pubic area buttocks anus anal cleft or cleavage b it shall be unlawful for any female person while on the premises of a commercial establishment located within the town at which ch 13  police reserve officers ch 15  zoning ch 23 revocation of occupational license if the owner operator licensee lessor lessee manager employee or any other person participating in the operation of a commercial establishment located within the town in which alcoholic beverages are offered for sale for consumption on the premises shall be found to have violated any sections of this chapter in addition to any other penalties prescribed the town council may revoke the occupational license for the establishment after giving a reasonable notice thereof to the holder of the license and animals fs ch 828  damage by dogs fs ch 767  livestock fs  58812 et seq  cruelty  82802 et seq protection of birds a the entire area embraced within the town is hereby designated as a bird sanctuary b it shall be unlawful for any person to trap hunt kill or attempt to trap hunt shoot kill or molest any bird or wild fowl in any manner or to rob bird nests or wild fowl nests within the town provided however if starlings or similar birds are found to be congregated in such numbers in any particular locality within said town to the extent that complaint is made to the town council that such birds constitute a nuisance or menace to health or property then in such case a meeting shall be called by the town council of representatives of the audubon society bird club garden club humane society or as many of the clubs as are found to exist in the town which are interested in such problems after having given at least three 3 days actual notice of the time and place of the meeting thereupon if as a result of the meeting no acceptable alternative is found to abate such nuisance then such birds may be destroyed in such numbers and in such manner as is deemed advisable by the town council under the supervision of the chief of police of the town or such other officer as may be designated by the chief of police  hog pens  permit required it shall be unlawful for any person to keep a hog or pig pen within the town without a special permit from the town council  cross reference town council  216  buildings and building regulations ch 6  zoning ch 23 town recreation facilitiesprohibitions a all pets and domestic animals are prohibited on the public beach and in the waters of the atlantic ocean adjacent thereto which are reserved for swimming it shall also be unlawful for any person to take into or to have any wild animal or livestock on the public beach and in the waters of the atlantic ocean or any town recreation facility feeding wild animals on the public beach or in town recreation facilities is prohibited b all pets and domestic animals are prohibited in any town recreation facility except domestic dogs which are specifically permitted within the designated areas of town dog parks dogs are not required to be on a leash when the dog is within the designated secure or offleash areas of town dog parks however the person who owns or has escorted the dog to the dog park shall maintain reasonable custody and control over the dog at all times c all dogs within a town dog park are required to have up to date vaccinations and be properly licensed beach county animal control the dog licensedog tag must be properly affixed to the dogs collar or harness any dog not being properly vaccinated licensed and tagged is prohibited in town dog parks d any dog which has been classified as dangerous or as vicious by the palm beach county animal care and control division is specifically prohibited in town dog parks see section 44 e service dogs or dogs used by law enforcement officers in the performance of their duty are exempt from subsections a and b hereinabove  22513 editors note  adopted feb 25 201 repealed  43 in its entirety and enacted new provisions to of or in charge of any dog to permit such dog to run at large within the town dogs may be taken to all public places within the towns corporate limits except those places where notice has been posted by the town as off limits for dogs so long as they remain at all times on a leash chain or similar restraining device and under the control of the custodian of the dog in this section at large shall mean that the animal is away from the premises of the owner or custodian of the dog and not under control of the custodian as set forth herein b if any dog shall run at large within the town proof of the identity of such dog and the ownership thereof shall be sufficient to find violation of the terms and provisions of this section the dog shall be subject to being picked up by the palm beach county animal care and control division the division and shall be placed there pursuant to the divisions rules and regulations owners of such dogs must present proof of ownershiprabies inoculation proper licensing and pay any charges as set forth by the division in order to obtain the release of their animals c any dog which has been classified as dangerous or as vicious by the division pursuant to the divisions procedures for such classification may be off the owners premises only under limited circumstances as set forth in the divisions rules and regulations d any person violating the provisions of this section shall be subject in addition to the fees and charges set forth in subsection b above to penalties as set forth in the schedule of fees and charges adopted by resolution of the town council and such penalties may then be revised from time to time by resolution of the town council additionally this section may be enforced by any lawful means available to the town including a hearing before the code enforcement board or the special magistrate  31003   12819 keeping of certain animals or birds prohibited it shall be unlawful to keep raise harbor andor maintain reserve officers ch 15  offenses ch 13  traffic and vehicles ch 19  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 17 fishing restricted it shall be unlawful for any person to fish from or to cast with any fly rod bait rod or spinning tackle from or upon the lantana municipal beach property at any time from three 3 hours after sunrise to one 1 hour before sunset  public beach  rules and regulations rules and regulations for the public beach of the town and its adjacent areas known as the lantana municipal beach are hereby promulgated the beach rules shall be enforced by the police department and the beach patrol these rules are supplemental to conduct prohibited elsewhere in the a1   9886 public beach  unlawful conduct it shall be unlawful for any person to disobey the rules and regulations for the lantana municipal beach violators shall be penalized in accordance with the town appropriate signs regarding the rules on the beach shall be conspicuously placed at the public beach neither the posting of the signs nor viewing of a sign by a violator need be provided for conviction hereof 1 littering no person shall place or throw any trash garbage refuse or other litter on the beach except in the receptacles provided 2 driving or parking on beach no private motor vehicles shall be driven or parked on the beach or on any unpaved area thereof 3 spearguns slings harpoons spearguns slings harpoons and similar equipment are prohibited on the beach and in the waters the extreme north and south boundaries are excepted for the sole purpose of being access routes for those using the instruments in waters other than the lantana municipal beach 4 skimboards no person shall use a skimboard or its equivalent on the beach or in the waters thereof unless specifically approved by the beach patrol 5 surfboards belly boards and similar equipment surfboards belly boards and similar equipment are prohibited from being used in the water area where swimmers are present or where determined by the beach patrol 6 bathing or swimming in surf area persons shall bathe or swim in the surfing area only when no surfboards are being used there 7 vessels or airplanes no person shall bring any boat or other vessel or amphibious airplane to less than eight hundred 800 feet of the shoreline of lantana municipal beach 8 use of beach for assemblies no person shall use the beach for the assembly of over fifty 50 persons without obtaining written permission of the town manager the request for such use shall be made to the town on forms provided by the town clerk 9 swimmers to stay within fifty 50 yards of shore as a condition of swimming at the lantana beach all swimmers in the waters thereof must remain within fifty 50 yards of shore swimmers must obey requests of lifeguards to remain within this area or leave the lantana municipal beach surfers in the surfing area are excepted from the provisions hereof 10 personal flotation devices no person shall use a raft inner tube beach ball or other personal flotation device beyond twentyfive 25 yards of shore surfers and those with boogie boards are exempted from the provisions herein 11 banning of public from beach area the beach patrol may when it is deemed necessary for the sake of public safety order all persons from the water or beach area a2   9886 secs 519530  reserved article iii  boats footnotes  3  editors note of adopted oct 26 198 renumbered former  533536 as 540543 of the ordinance enacted new  533539 to read as herein set out cross reference throwing stones at any marine vessels railroad trains car or any other vehicle prohibited  134 state law reference boats fs ch 327  fishing fs ch 370 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning prohibited area shall mean the lake bottom lands within the town not previously reserved by ordinance or the the anchorage or parking of vessels vessel shall mean watercraft of every description used or capable of being used as a means of transportation on water in addition to the definitions contained in florida statutes as amended mooring shall mean any appliance used to secure a vessel other than to a pier anchor shall mean any appliance used to secure a vessel other than to a pier which is carried aboard such vessel as regular equipment when under way pier shall mean any fixed or floating structure that is part of or affixed to land such as a wharf dock float or other loading facility    1o2687 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 limitation on anchoring mooring parking in prohibited area  mooring permit required it is declared to be unlawful for any person to anchor moor or park in a stationary position or cause or permit or allow any other person under his control or command to do same any vessel in the prohibited area for a period of time of more than ninetysix 96 continuous hours in any consecutive thirtyday period the occupants of such vessel shall obtain a mooring permit from the police department and register the occupants and vessel on forms provided by the chief of police within eighteen 18 hours after such vessel has been secured for anchoring mooring or parking in the prohibited area a mooring permit fee shall be required as established by the council  cross reference offenses ch 13  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 17  trailers and trailer camps ch 20  zoning ch 23 unlawfully parked vesselspolice to impound the police department of the town is authorized and directed to take into custody and impound any such vessel and any such vessel taken into custody and impounded under the authority of the police department shall not be released therefrom until the charges for towing such vessel and storage charges have been paid the charge for towing or removal of any such vessel and storage charges shall be reasonable and shall be the customary charges prevailing in the town for such services  1o2687 sameowner to be notified upon impoundment whenever any vessel is taken into custody and impounded by the authority of the police department as authorized herein and the name and address of the owner of such vessel can be ascertained by the police department it shall immediately give or cause to be given notice in writing to such owner of the fact of such removal and the reason therefor and the place to which such vessel has been removed  1o2687 sameprocedure in event owner cannot be found whenever the police department authorizes the removal of such vessel from the prohibited area as authorized herein and the police department does not know and is not able to ascertain the name and address of the owner of such vessel or for any other reason is unable to give the notice to the owner and in the event the vessel is not returned to the owner within a period of three 3 days after same has been taken into custody and impounded the police department shall immediately send or cause to be sent a written notice of such impoundment by mail to the division of marine resources of the department of natural resources and shall file a copy of such notice with the person who has been authorized to have custody of the impounded vessel for the purpose of storage such notice shall include a complete description of the vessel the date time and place from which it was removed the reason for such removal and the name of the storage facility or place where the vessel is stored  1o2687 sameunclaimed vessel to be sold  certification of sale a if the owner fails to claim the vessel within ten 10 days after the police department has sent its notice to the division of marine resources such vessel shall be sold to the highest bidder at public auction by the police department at some place within the town  but prior to the sale a notice shall be published one 1 time in a local newspaper published in the county and circulated in the town publication shall be at least ten 10 days prior to the date of sale such notice shall give the time and place of sale and describe the vessel to be sold a copy of such notice shall be mailed to the owner if his name and address be known at least ten 10 days before the date of such sale the town shall not guarantee title to such vessel or to deliver a title of ownership but shall furnish the purchaser a certificate in substantially the following form certificate number _____ certificate of sale town of lantana police department lantana florida this is to certify that the following described vessel was impounded and placed in the custody of the police department where it was held for twenty 20 days after which time the police department made every reasonable effort to find the owner of the same or if found such owner failed to repossess same this vessel was sold to the highest bidder at public auction after legal advertisement this certificate of sale is therefor issued to _____ residing at _____ description of vessel _____ dated at lantana florida this______day of_________________19___ ___________ name and title of police officer b this form shall be in duplicate the original shall be given to the purchaser and the duplicate bound in a book of record for the purposes intended  1o2687 samedisposal of proceeds proceeds of sale of the impounded vessel shall be deposited in the fines and forfeitures account after paying all the costs actually expended for towing storage advertising and sale of such vessel  1o2687 sameclaiming of vessel by owner  payment of costs the owner of such impounded vessel may take possession of such vessel at anytime prior to the time of sale provided herein but such owner shall reimburse the town for all reasonable expenses for removal storage advertising and other expenses incurred as a result of the impoundment of such vessel  1o2687 samereclamation of owner after sale the proceeds from the sale of any impounded vessel paid into the fine and forfeitures account shall not be expended or disbursed for ninety 90 days after the date of such sale at any time during such period the owner upon providing proof of such ownership of such vessel evidenced by documentary written evidence may recover back from the fines and forfeitures account the proceeds of the sale less all the expenses incurred in regard to removal storage advertising and a commission of five 5 percent on the gross sales price of such vessel for the cost of making such sale  1o2687 person on a vessel under his control or command to discharge any human or animal excreta from any head toilet or similar facility or in any manner from any vessel or throw discharge deposit or leave or cause or permit to be thrown discharged deposited or left from any vessel any refuse matter of any description into the waters of the prohibited area  cross reference garbage and refuse disposal ch longer than is necessary to the user of said boat ramp for the purpose for which the same is provided namely to launch boats take boats out of the lake and while such boats are actually in the water
