see editors note following  1118 due dates  delinquency penalties  noncompliance penalties a all business taxes receipts shall be sold by the town clerk beginning july 1 of each year are due and payable on or before september 30 of each year and expire on september 30 of the succeeding year if september 30 falls on a weekend or holiday the tax is due and payable on or before the first working day following september 30 business tax receipts that are not renewed when due and payable are delinquent and subject to delinquency penalty of ten 10 percent for the month of october plus an additional five 5 percent for each subsequent month of delinquency until paid however the total delinquency penalty may not exceed twentyfive 25 percent of the business tax for the delinquent establishment b any person who engages in or manages any business occupation or profession without first obtaining a local business tax receipt if required is subject to penalty of twentyfive 25 percent of the tax due in addition to any other penalty provided by law or ordinance c any person who engages in any business occupation or profession covered by this article who does not pay the required business tax within one hundred fifty 150 days after the initial notice of tax due and who does not obtain the required business tax receipt is subject to civil actions and penalties including court costs reasonable attorneys fees additional administrative costs incurred as a result of collection efforts and a penalty of up to two hundred fifty dollars $25000    12886   62794   101199   91106   62507 state law reference similar provisions fs   business tax receipts to be posted or carried all business tax receipts granted hereunder shall be posted in a conspicuous place on the premises where the business is being conducted either stationary or mobile or in case of solicitors and canvassers such business tax receipt must be carried upon their person  62386   91106 note see editors note following  1118 issuance suspension or revocation of business tax receipt  appeal procedure a no business tax receipt shall be issued unless it is found that the proposed business and location comply with the town zoning code and other applicable town ordinances b no business tax receipt shall be issued for an occupation where certification is required under state law unless proof of said certification is provided c a business tax receipt may be suspended or revoked upon a finding that the business is operating in violation of the town codes d an initial determination upon issuance or revocation will be made by the appropriate town official e the applicant shall have ten 10 days after receiving notification in writing from the town clerk of the suspension or revocation to appeal the determination of the appropriate town official to the town council the request for appeal shall be filed with the town clerk in writing f within fifteen 15 days after receipt of the appeal the town council shall hold a quasijudicial hearing in the denial of the business tax receipt application or the suspension or revocation    62386   91106 effect of issuance of business tax receipt the issuance of a business tax receipt shall merely indicate that the applicant has paid the appropriate business tax the mistaken issuance of a business tax receipt shall not be deemed to be a waiver of any provision of the town code nor shall the issuance of a business tax receipt be construed to be a judgment of the town as to the competence of the applicant to transact the business for which the business tax receipt was issued  62386   91106 note see editors note following  1118   transfer of business tax receipt a transfer to new owner business tax receipts issued under the provisions of this chapter may be transferred with the approval and written authorization of the town endorsed thereon for the same business activity for which they were originally issued when there is a bona fide sale and transfer of the property used and employed in the business  however such transferred business tax receipt shall not be considered valid for any longer time nor for any place other than that for which it was originally issued provided that the original business tax receipt shall be surrendered to and filed with the town at the time application for transfer is made the transferred business tax receipt after being approved shall be of the same force and effect as the original business tax receipt at the time any business tax receipt is transferred the person applying for such transfer shall pay to the town a transfer fee as well as an inspection administrative service fee the amount of which shall be set by resolution of the town council and amended from time to time as necessary to cover administrative costs b transfer to new location business tax receipts may also be transferred from location to location with the approval and written authorization of the town endorsed thereon provided no change of ownership has occurred or is in the process and provided that the business tax receipt classification remains unaffected such transferred business tax receipt shall not be valid for any longer time nor for any other type of business than that which was originally issued in order for a business tax receipt to be legally transferred to a new location the original business tax receipt shall be surrendered to and filed with the town at the time application for transfer is made and such transferred business tax receipt after being approved shall be of the same force and effect as the original business tax receipt at the time any business tax receipt is transferred the person applying for such transfer shall pay to the town a transfer fee as well as an inspection administrative service fee the amount of which fees shall be set by resolution of the town council and amended from time to time to cover administrative costs c transfer to new name business tax receipts granted or issued under the provisions of this chapter may be transferred to a new business name with the approval and written authorization of the town endorsed thereon provided that the classification of the business tax receipt does not change the location of the business and the ownership of the business remains the same such transferred business tax receipt shall not be valid for any longer time nor for any other place than that for which it was originally issued the original business tax receipt shall be surrendered to and filed with the town at the time application for transfer is made and such transferred business tax receipt after being approved shall be of the same force and effect as the original business tax receipt at the time any business tax receipt is transferred the person applying for such transfer shall pay to the town a transfer fee the amount of which shall be set by resolution of the town council and amended from time to time to cover administrative costs  92688   101199   91106 editors note of adopted sept 26 198 repealed former  11231 and enacted new provisions to read as set out herein former   pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted dec 8 1986   duplicate business tax receipts the town shall charge one dollar $100 for each duplicate business tax receipt issued to replace any business tax receipt issued under the provisions of this chapter which has been lost stolen defaced or destroyed without any willful conduct on the part of the holder of the business tax receipt upon the filing by the receipt holder of a statement attesting to such fact  12886   91106 ultra vires transactions  fraudulent business tax receipts void no business tax receipt issued under the provisions of this chapter shall protect any person from prosecution for transacting any business trade or profession not covered by the license no business tax receipt issued shall protect any merchant doing business with a greater stock in trade than is covered by the business tax receipt or any hotel keeper or rooming house keeper having a greater number of rooms than is covered by the business tax receipt any business tax receipt issued upon any false statement made under oath shall be considered as void ab initio and shall not protect the holder thereof from prosecution for transacting business without a business tax receipt    91106 special events permits  temporary recreation event permits a permit required any person corporation or other entity of any kind whatsoever who desires to conduct any type of special event or temporary recreational event within the town which is not covered under the regular business tax receipt and registration sections set forth herein must obtain a permit from the town in order that the town may adequately provide for the potential impacts created by the proposed event the fee for such permit shall be set by resolution of the town council additionally vendors at special events shall pay a special permit fee for that event  which fee shall be set by resolution of the town council b written application written application must be submitted to the town at least fifteen 15 days prior to the date for which the special event is proposed  which application shall contain the following information 1 type of event 2 sponsor or persons responsible for event 3 proposed location with owners written consent 4 proposed date commencement time and duration of event 5 approximate number of participants 6 proof of insurance 7 traffic firerescue utilities impact if any and proposed mitigation plan 8 copy of all required state and county permits if event will be held on or utilize state andor county controlled property c minimum impact all special events shall be coordinated with the town in order to lessen adverse impacts and to allow for continuous protection of the health safety and welfare of all in order to provide such protection all applications for special events shall be submitted to the town plan review committee prc for review the prc may approve the application as presented or may approve with conditions placed upon the application which are reasonably calculated to reduce impacts created by the proposed event 1   72390   62794   101199   91106   special permits to nonprofit enterprise a the town shall issue permits without payment of any business tax or other charges therefore to any person or organization for the conduct or operation of occasional sales andor fundraising projects held by nonprofit enterprises when the applicant signs an affidavit that the applicant operates without private profit for a civic charitable youth service fraternal or religious purpose b special permittees must conform a person operating under a special permit shall operate his nonprofit enterprise in compliance with this section and all other rules and regulations c any person signing a false affidavit pursuant to this section shall be subject to any and all enforcement proceedings as provided by law  12886   62794   91106   exemptions a the following persons are exempted from the payment of a business tax 1 disabled veterans who served in the united states armed services  2 disabled persons physically incapable of manual labor  3 widows with minor dependents  4 churches  5 persons sixtyfive 65 years of age or older with not more than one 1 employee and who only use their own capital in an amount not to exceed one thousand dollars $100000  and 6 any other persons or entities exempted by state law b any person entitled to an exemption provided by this section shall upon application and furnishing of the necessary proof execute an affidavit supporting his right to exemption and be issued a business tax receipt which shall have plainly stamped or written across the face thereon the reason for exemption  12886   62794   101199   91106 professional licenses a tax the tax provided in section 1128 for architects auditors auctioneers accountants dentists draftsmen engineers lawyers osteopaths chiropractors chiropodists phrenologists physicians surgeons real estate agents or brokers or other similar businesses professions or occupations shall be construed to mean that each individual shall pay the business tax therein provided whether engaging in business himself or in partnership with another b credentials any person applying for or renewing a local business tax receipt to practice any profession regulated by the department of business and professional regulation or any board or commission thereof must exhibit an active state license registration or certificate or proof of copy of same before such local business tax receipt may be issued    12886   101199   91106   various types of rental property defined  business tax receipt required a definitions the following definitions shall apply to the rental of all units utilized for residential purposes long term rentals the rental lease sublease or assignment of property for a period of time in excess of thirty 30 days residential rental property residential rental property shall include but is not limited to dwelling units such as rooming houses singlefamily residences duplexes and multifamily units when these properties are rented leased subleased or assigned to dwellers as opposed to being owner occupied these various types of units are further defined in appendix a of the subdivision regulation code or in the zoning code which may be found at respectively of this term rentals the rental lease sublease or assignment of property for thirty 30 days or less b business tax receipt required for all residential rental properties all residential rental property as defined above located in the town must pay business tax and must acquire a business tax receipt short term rentals as defined above are prohibited for singlefamily houses located in the r1 and r1a zoning districts  see section 23135 of the towns zoning code additional regulations regarding residential rental properties are found at of of this to sexual offenders andor predators in order to apply for a local business tax receipt to rent lease sublease or assign to others residential property within the town the following requirements must be observed 1 all owners of residential rental property as defined hereinabove shall file a completed rental information card with the town clerks office after they have received and read the towns rental guidelines for landlords and tenants brochure  this information card must be filed prior to the issuance of a business tax receipt for the rental of residential real property 2 after the submission of an information card and application for a business tax receipt an inspection of the premises shall be made by the town in order to insure that the premises is in compliance with the towns code see also section 1118 herein c business tax receipt required for all commercial rental properties all commercial uses are required to have business tax receipts in accordance with section 1116 hereinabove d enforcement this section may be enforced by the town by any lawful means  82487   111405   91106 distributor operator  defined a the word distributor as used in this chapter shall be defined to mean any person firm association or corporation who engages in selling distributing or conveying any ticket or ticket containers for trade or amusement purposes at wholesale to any person firm association or corporation in the town for ultimate use by the public b the word operate as used herein shall mean a retail merchant or other person firm association or corporation who shall display offer for sale or sell any ticket for trade or amusement purposes to the public by the use of ticket containers    91106 cross reference definition and rules of construction generally  12 schedule of business taxes the amount of business tax which shall be paid to the town per annum by each and every person firm associate or corporation engaged in or practicing such business profession or occupation as herein contained shall be established by ordinance in accordance with fs ch 205 such schedule of business taxes shall not be codified but shall be available at town hall for inspection by the public during normal business hours  12886   82487   92688   121288   41089   72390   62794   101199 public rightsofway and public property for the solicitation or sale of goods or services for profit is expressly prohibited b private property the use of private property for the solicitation or sale of goods and services for profit by mobile or stationary vendors peddlers hawkers etc other than in a permanent building which otherwise conforms to all ordinances of the town is hereby prohibited except where such uses 1 are located within a business or commercial zone  2 are specifically authorized in writing by the owner or lessee of the subject property  3 are to exist on any given location within the town for no longer than three 3 hours in any twentyfourhour period  and 4 are issued a valid business tax receipt c not for profit solicitation all notforprofit solicitation shall require a nofee business tax receipt to be issued by the town council only to groups and organizations regularly meeting within the town 1   91106 secs 11311145  reserved article iii  game rooms definitions for purposes of this article the term pinball andor game room shall mean any business location where the primary purpose of the business maintained therein is to provide gaming devices machines or apparatus for the use andor entertainment of the public said machine being any machine which upon the insertion of a coin slug token plate disc or in any other manner manipulated may be used as a game or amusement whether or not registering a score and whether or not its operation demands skill or chance or both  cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 game room license required no person shall operate a pinball andor game room in the town without first having obtained a game room license from the town such game room license shall be in addition to the requirement to obtain the appropriate business tax receipt as set forth herein above at business tax and registration    91106 game room license fee the annual fee for a pinball andor game room license shall be as established by resolution of the town council the applicantlicensee must also pay all additional fees andor taxes imposed by this chapter as established by resolution of the town council    91106 application for game room license an application for a game room license shall be made in accordance with this chapter    91106 location no license shall be granted for a pinball andor game room located within nine hundred 900 feet from the nearest boundary of a parcel of real estate having situated upon it a school church library public park playground or recreational facility or another pinball andor game room as defined herein  regulations a a licensed pinball andor game room shall 1 be closed to the public between the hours of  pm and  am and prior to  noon on sundays 2 the occupant load permitted in any pinball andor game room or portion thereof shall be determined by dividing the net floor area or space assigned to that use by seven 7 square feet per person this load permitted shall not exceed the allowable load as determined by exit requirements 3 have an attendant over twentyone 21 years of age on the premises at all times in which the business is open to the public who shall be in such a position as to have clear view of all the amusement devices and activity taking place on the premises 4 provide separate restroom facilities for male and female patrons 5 provide adequate and orderly parking for all bicycles and keep the storefront unobstructed so that the sidewalks are clear and open to pedestrian traffic b no licensee proprietor manager or employee shall permit 1 any gambling on the license premises  2 the consumption of alcoholic beverages within the licensed premises  3 such noise either by mechanical means or noise on the part of the patrons which shall cause a disturbance of the peace to the adjacent and surrounding uses c a licensed premises shall be required to meet the requirements of the fire zoning sanitary electrical building and plumbing codes of the town  revocation of game room license a game room license issued hereunder shall be subject to revocation by the town council for a violation of any of the provisions of this article after a hearing thereon  licensee to receive ten 10 days notice of said hearing and the reasons for which said licensee must show cause why his license should not be revoked    91106 penalty for violations any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this article or permitting a violation hereof in addition to the revocation of the license shall be guilty of a violation of this article as determined by the lantana board and shall be fined in accordance with the rules and regulations as established by the board pursuant to fs ch 162  secs 11541165  reserved article iv  garage sales footnotes  3  cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 definition garage sales as used in this article is hereby defined to mean any sale or offering for sale of personnel property by a person or persons of a family or other household unit said personal property having been acquired possessed and used by the family or household for personal as opposed to business or commercial use when such sale is conducted at the present residence of such family or household garage sales shall include sales commonly referred to as patio sales driveway sales yard sales and other such sales garage sales shall not include the sale or offering for sale of goods of more than one family or household  permit required no garage sale may be conducted within the town without a permit having been first issued for such sale by the town such permit shall set forth and restrict the time and location of such garage sale no more than two 2 permits may be issued to one residence andor family or household during any calendar year such permit shall be limited in time to no more than the daylight hours of two 2 consecutive days if the sale commences without a permit the owner will be required to cease operations remove displayed goods and obtain a permit  written statement required prior to issuance of any garage sale permit the person conducting such sale shall file a written statement with the town setting forth the following information 1 persons interest in the residential propertyownership current lessee or such other control as the person may have  2 ownership of the property to be sold  3 purposes to which the property to be sold has been previously used  4 affirmative statement that the property to be sold was neither acquired nor consigned for the purpose of resale  permit fee no garage sale permit shall be issued by the town until a fee in the amount of five dollars $500 has first been received therefor  sign permitted three 3 garage sale signs shall be issued by the town to the resident along with the garage sale permit one 1 sign of the issued signs shall be the only sign allowed to be displayed on the property of the residence where the garage sale is being conducted however two 2 of these signs may be displayed off premises providing the signs are free standing and shall not be attached to trees sign poles andor anything else whatsoever these offpremises signs may be placed on private property with consent of the property owner andor on public rightofway swale areas adjacent to public roadways if such public rightofway is adjacent to a municipal road signs may not be placed on county or state road rightsofway signs are allowed only during the times of the sales as designated on the permit and must be removed immediately after the garage sale has concluded the resident conducting the garage sale is responsible for the removal of the above said signs and will be subject to a fine of fifty dollars $5000 imposed by the town of lantana for signs not removed immediately after the garage sale has concluded in accordance with the dates allowed by permit    61394 parking all parking of vehicles shall be conducted in compliance with all applicable laws and ordinances further the police department may enforce such temporary controls which would alleviate any special hazards andor congestion created by any garage sale  display of permit the permit required by this article shall be prominently displayed at such sale in such a way so that same may be easily viewed by the public  exceptions the provisions of this article shall not apply to sales of personal property made pursuant to a valid order of a court of competent jurisdiction nor to sales by churches schools civic organizations or charitable organizations  compliance with other regulations garage sales shall be conducted in compliance with all laws ordinances rules and regulations not in conflict herewith  penalty any person firm or corporation who shall violate a provision of this article or fail to comply therewith or with any of the requirements thereof or permit a violation thereof in conducting any garage sale not in accordance with the provisions hereof shall be guilty of a violation of this article as determined by the lantana board and shall be fined in accordance with the rules and regulations as established by the board pursuant to fs ch 162  secs 11761190  reserved article v  bingo games footnotes  4  state law reference bingo fs   charitable nonprofit organizations nonprofit or veterans organizations engaged in charitable civic community benevolent religious or scholastic works andor other similar activities which organizations have been in existence for a period of three 3 years or more may conduct bingo games or guest games as authorized by fs section  by donating the entire proceeds derived from the conduct of games to these stated endeavors under the additional town regulations herein if a nonprofit organization is not engaged in any of the endeavors stated then its right to conduct games hereunder shall be conditioned upon the return of all the proceeds from such games to the players in the form of prizes if at the conclusion of play on any day there remains proceeds which have not been paid out as prizes then on the next scheduled day of play the organization shall conduct the game without charge so as to exhaust the proceeds carried over a1 state law reference fs  2 3 application and registration fee such organization shall file an application under oath on forms provided by the town a nonrefundable registration fee of fifty dollars $5000 shall be paid annually for the cost of processing the application investigation of the applicant identification card of the bingo operators inspection fees and auditing the financial records the registration fee must accompany the application the fee is not prorated according to the date of the application and must be paid once each fiscal year to the town regardless of the number of games to be played if the annual registration fee is not paid on or before october 31st in the second and all succeeding years then the permit of the organization shall be null and void a2 departmental approvals  final permit by town council the sworn application shall be received by the town clerk in duplicate after initial filing with the town clerk the application is to be submitted for approval or disapproval with specific reasons for disapproval to the chief of police fire chief and building inspector thereupon the town council shall upon consideration of the application at its next regular meeting or special meeting either grant or deny the issuance of a bingo permit in its sound and sole judgment in the event of denial the council must make findings of fact and state reasons for its decision a3 bingo operator  designation identification etc the operator of any bingo or guest game must be a resident of lantana a bona fide member of the organization sponsoring such games and shall not be compensated in any way including salary or expenses for the operation of said games the operator shall obtain a lantana police identification card with photograph and right thumb print affixed thereon and which id card shall be in his possession during all games and shall be exhibited to any of the enumerated town department heads upon request a4 books and records  annual accounting  inspection audit the organization bingo operator and officers shall maintain accurate records in a bound book with numbered pages detailing the hours and dates of the games played number of games played unit cost of cards gross amount of monies received per day amount of monies given for prizes or cost of prizes cost or overhead with purpose and to whom paid and net revenue derived per day such books and records as well as any related data of the organization are subject to inspection and audit at any reasonable hour by the chief of police acting chief of police and the mayor an annual accounting of all receipts and disbursements shall be filed with the city clerk on or before october 31 of each year the town council shall have the right to require additional information and reports as may be necessary to insure that all laws are being observed any change in the officers of the organization shall be reported by letter signed by an officer to the mayor and town clerk a5 restriction on location of games  adults only no bingo or guest games shall be played at the town hall no one is allowed to play who is under eighteen 18 years of age the organization must hold said games at the scheduled times and places in a manner so as not to create a nuisance in the neighborhood of the approved site a6 state law reference similar provisions fs  9 two games per week  jackpot and prize limits bingo or guest games shall not exceed two 2 per week for an organization there shall be no more than three 3 prizes or jackpots on any one day of play jackpots shall not exceed two hundred fifty dollars $25000 all other game prizes shall not exceed fifty dollars $5000 a7 state law reference similar provisions fs  46 penalty provision it shall be unlawful to conduct such games and to use the proceeds thereof except in strict compliance with fs section  and this chapter although the permit does not contain a termination date the continuance of the permit from year to year is conditioned on the terms and provisions contained herein and the permit may be revoked by official action of the town council after reasonable notice of violation to the organization a8 secs 119911119  reserved article vi  vending machines footnotes  5  cross reference signs and the insertion or depositing of coins or currency or free of charge  2888 sameprohibited on roadways no person shall install use or maintain any newsrack which projects onto into or over any part of the roadway of any public street or which rests wholly or in part upon along or over any portion of a roadway  2888 sameprohibited in certain cases on sidewalks parkways no person shall install use or maintain any newsrack which in whole or in part rests upon in or over any sidewalk or parkway when such installation use or maintenance endangers the safety of persons or property  or when such site or location is used for public utility purposes public transportation purposes or other government use  or when such newsrack unreasonably interferes with or impedes the flow of pedestrian or vehicular traffic the ingress into or egress from any residences place of business or any legally parked or stopped vehicle or the use of poles posts traffic signs or signals hydrants mailboxes or other objects permitted on or near said location  or when such newsrack interferes with the cleaning of any sidewalk by the use of any mechanical sidewalk cleaning machinery or otherwise  2888 samestandards when located on sidewalks parkways any newsrack which in whole or in part rests upon in or over any sidewalk or parkway shall comply with the following standards 1 no newsrack shall exceed four 4 feet in height two 2 feet in width or two 2 feet in depth 2 newsracks shall only be placed near a curb or adjacent to the wall of a building newsracks placed near the curb shall be placed no less than eighteen 18 inches nor more than twentyfour 24 inches from the edge of the curb newsracks placed adjacent to the wall of a building shall be parallel to such wall and not more than six 6inches from the wall no newsrack shall be placed or maintained on a sidewalk or parkway opposite a newsstand or other newsrack 3 no newsrack shall be chained bolted or otherwise attached to any property not owned by the owner of the newsrack 4 newsracks may be chained or otherwise attached to one another  however not more than three 3 newsracks may be joined together in this manner and a space of not less than eighteen 18 inches shall separate each group of three 3 newsracks so attached 5 no newsrack or group of attached newsracks allowed under subsection 4 hereof shall weigh in the aggregate in excess of one hundred 100 pounds when empty 6 no newsrack shall be placed installed used or maintained a within five 5 feet of any marked crosswalk b within fifteen 15 feet of the curb return of any unmarked crosswalk c within three 3 feet of any fire hydrant fire call box or other emergency facility d within five 5 feet of any driveway e within five 5 feet ahead and fifteen 15 feet to the rear of any sign marking a designated bus stop f within five 5 feet of any bus bench g at any location where the clear space for passageway of pedestrians is reduced to less than six 6 feet h within five 5 feet of any area improved with lawn flowers shrubs or trees or within five 5 feet of any display window of any building abutting the sidewalk or parkway in such a manner as to impede or interfere with the reasonable use of such window for display purposes 7 no newsrack shall be used for advertising signs or publicity purposes other than that dealing with the display sale or purpose of the newspaper or news periodical sold therein  or dispensed free of charge 8 each newsrack shall be maintained in a clean and neat condition and in good repair at all times  2888 sameinformation to be shown on rack every person who places or maintains a newsrack on the streets of the town shall have his name address and telephone number affixed thereto in a place where such information may be easily seen  2888 sameviolations  penalties any newsrack installed or maintained in violation of this if the owner thereof fails or refuses to correct the violation within ten 10 days of written notices of the violation subject the owner of the newsrack to the penalties provided for in of this or to the jurisdiction of the code enforcement board of the town  2888 secs 1113011140  reserved fs ch 185  premium tax fs  18508 secs 1115711159  reserved article ix  convenience stores definition as used in this article the term convenience store means any place of business that is engaged in the retail sale of groceries including the sale of prepared foods and gasoline and services that is regularly open for business at any time between the hours of  pm and  am and that is attended during such hours by one 1 employee the term convenience store does not include a store which is solely or primarily a restaurant  42291 convenience store security each convenience store located within the corporate limits of the town shall 1 be equipped with the following security devices a a silent alarm that notifies local law enforcement or a private security agency that a robbery is taking place  b a security camera system capable of returning an image to assist in the identification and apprehension of a robber  and c a drop safe or cash management device that provides minimum access to the facilitys cash receipts  2 lighted parking lots illuminated at an intensity of two 2 footcandles per square foot with a uniformity ratio of no more than five 5 to one 1 at eighteen 18 inches above the surface  3 post a conspicuous sign in the convenience store entrance which states that the cash register contains fifty dollars $5000 or less  4 maintain window signage so that there is a clear and unobstructed view of the cash register and transaction area  5 prohibit window tinting on the windows of the establishment if such tinting reduces exterior or interior viewing during the hours of operation to which this article is applicable  6 install height markers at the entrance of the establishment which display height measures from the floor  and 7 establish a cash management policy to limit the amount of available cash on hand between the hours of  pm and  am  42291 training of employees no later than  the owner or principal operator of a convenience store shall provide proper robbery deterrence and safety training to all its employees who work between the hours of  pm and  am the convenience store owner or operator may utilize a training program of his or her choice however said program must be submitted in writing to the attorney general for approval  42291 noncompliance should any convenience store fail to comply with any of the provisions of this article written notice shall be mailed to the owner and principal operator of the store requesting compliance within ten 10 days if noncompliance with this article is corrected within ten 10 days after receipt of written notice of said noncompliance no further action will be taken however any owner or principal operator of a convenience store who fails to comply after the tenday written notice shall be determined to have willfully and deliberately violated the requirements of this article which shall be enforced code enforcement board or code enforcement citation system or shall be assessed a fine of five hundred dollars $50000 per day not to exceed five thousand dollars $500000 which shall constitute a civil fine and which shall be paid to the town upon a complaint being filed by the town with the appropriate court  42291 secs 1116411190  reserved article x  pay telephone installation purpose the purpose of this article is to provide standards for the following the erection construction reconstruction installation operation maintenance dismantling testing repair and use of pay telephones in upon along across above over under or in any manner connected with public lands andor the streets andor sidewalks within the corporate limits of the town as now or in the future may exist  82498 definitions for the purpose of this article and any agreement or permit entered into or issued in accordance herewith the following terms phrases words and their derivations shall be defined as follows department shall mean the building department of the town official shall mean the building official of the town or hisher designee pay telephone shall mean any selfservice or coin or credit card operated telephone including any enclosure or bank of such telephones placed adjacent to each other that in any manner is connected with public lands andor the public streets andor sidewalks within the town pay telephone permit agreement shall mean the document by which a privilege is granted by the town to authorize a person to erect construct reconstruct install operate maintain dismantle test repair and use pay telephones which occupy any public lands andor the streets andor sidewalks within the town any pay telephone permit agreement approved in accordance herewith shall be nonexclusive and shall be subject to approval as to form by the town attorney permittee shall mean any person issued a permit in accordance with the provisions of this article who is responsible for the erection construction reconstruction installation operation maintenance dismantling testing repair and use of pay telephones in any manner connected with the streets andor sidewalks within the town person shall mean an individual business firm corporation association partnership or other organization or group of persons sidewalk shall mean that area reserved for the public use of pedestrian traffic within the towns rightsofway street shall mean all that area reserved for the public use for public rightofway purposes and shall include but not be limited to highways avenues roads drives lanes boulevards courts concourses bridges culsdesac tunnels waterways parks roadways parkways and alleys town shall mean the town of lantana florida its elected officials its agents and employees  82498 pay telephone permit agreement required a no person may place or maintain any pay telephone on or above any street or sidewalk in the corporate limits of the town without having first entered into a pay telephone permit agreement with the town as provided in this article having obtained a business tax receipt as a public utility service provider and having paid all applicable permit fees b any pay telephone permit issued by the town shall continue in full force and effect so long as the permittee is in compliance with this article all applicable federal state and local ordinances and regulations are followed and the space occupied is not needed for public purposes failure to comply with any applicable ordinances or laws or failure to pay required fees including annual renewal fees shall result in automatic revocation of any permit issued and immediate removal of the pay telephones c in the event any pay telephone permit shall be revoked or shall lapse the applicable pay telephones shall be removed from the streets andor sidewalks by the former permittee in accordance with the provisions of this article  82498   91106 permit locations a any pay telephone permit issued in accordance herewith shall apply only to the location stated on same b the exact location and means of installation of pay telephones shall be subject to the departments approval c nothing in this article shall be construed as a representation promise or guarantee by the town that any other permit or other authorization required under any town ordinance for the installation of pay telephones shall be issued  82498 technical standards all technical standards governing construction reconstruction installation operation maintenance dismantling testing repair and use of pay telephones provided for herein shall be in accordance with all applicable federal state and local laws and regulations including but not limited to the most recent editions of the building the electrical by the town  82498 powers and duties of the building official the building official shall have the following powers and duties 1 to receive and review applications for pay telephone permits  and 2 to review and cause to be audited all reports and filings submitted by the permittee to the town pursuant to this article  82498 permit required  fee a a building permit fee shall be required for the installation of each pay telephone which utilizes public publicly owned lands or public rightsofway such building permit may not be issued until a pay telephone permit agreement as referenced in section 11193 hereinabove has been fully executed and submitted to the department along with applicable fees the amount of the pay telephone permit agreement fee annual renewal fee and any and all other applicable fees shall be set by resolution of the town council and may be amended from time to time as necessary b any pay telephones currently existing on public lands or within the public rightsofway must make application for a permit within three 3 months of the date of adoption of this article failure to comply shall result in removal of the pay telephone c failure to pay all fees on a timely basis shall result in automatic revocation of the permit and removal of the pay telephone in accordance with section 11193  82498 other fees  taxes nothing in this article shall be construed to limit the liability of the permittee for all applicable federal state and local taxes andor fees  82498 use of streets andor sidewalks it shall be unlawful for the permittee or any other person to open or otherwise disturb the surface of any street andor sidewalk for any purpose whatsoever without obtaining approval to do so after having been issued a building permit for the construction or installation work additionally a pay telephone permit agreement must be fully executed and submitted to the town along with the then applicable pay telephone permit agreement fee prior to the commencement of any installation  82498 location and placement of pay telephones a the installation of pay telephones in any manner connected with the streets andor sidewalks within the town shall be subject to approval by the building department and shall conform to the following requirements 1 it shall be free of interference with the flow of pedestrians wheelchairs or vehicular traffic  2 it shall allow ingress or egress from any residence or place of business  3 it shall be free of interference with the function of traffic signs or signals hydrants or mailboxes b pay telephones shall be placed or otherwise secured so as to prevent their being blown down or around the street andor sidewalk but they shall not be chained or otherwise secured to any traffic or street signs signals hydrants mailboxes or other street amenities c pay telephones shall be placed installed used or maintained so as to be in compliance with the town shall not be located within five 5 feet of any pedestrian crosswalk bus stop taxistand or counter window or within fifteen 15 feet of any fire hydrant fire call box police call box or other emergency facility d the following minimum distance requirement measured along the route of ordinary pedestrian travel shall apply unless approved in writing by the building official no pay telephone shall be placed within three hundred 300 feet of any other pay telephone or telephone bank on the same side of the street on a sidewalk in a multifamily commercial or industrial zoning district as described in zoning e pay telephones shall not be installed in the r1a r1 or r3 residential zoning districts as described in zoning f should the location andor use of a pay telephone constitute a threat to the health safety and welfare of the community in the opinion of the building official the permit issued by the building department shall be revoked after ten 10 days written notice to the permittee and the pay telephone shall be removed from the street or sidewalk at the expense of the permittee  82498 standards for maintenance installation and operation of pay telephones pay telephones shall comply with the requirements of all applicable federal state and local laws including the applicable provisions of the americans with disabilities act of 1992 and the following standards 1 pay telephone enclosures surrounding pay telephones shall not exceed eight 8 feet in height four 4 feet in width or four 4 feet depth 2 pay telephone enclosures shall be lighted by means of low voltage lighting 3 pay telephones shall be equipped with coin return mechanisms to permit a person using the pay telephone to secure an immediate refund when there is a busy signal or no answer to a call placed the coin return mechanism shall be maintained in good working order 4 each pay telephone shall have affixed to it in a place visible to everyone using the pay telephone the name and address of the permittee and the telephone number of a working service to report a malfunction of the pay telephone or to secure a refund 5 the design of all pay telephone enclosures including signage shall be subject to the approval of the building department 6 pay telephones shall be maintained in a neat and clean condition and in good repair at all times 7 any permittee who fails to maintain its pay telephone in working condition may be given a 30day written notice by the building department to repair the pay telephone if the pay telephone is not in working condition at the end of the 30day period after proper notice is given the building department may revoke the permit and the pay telephone shall be removed by the former permittee or by the town if the town removes same it shall be stored within a town facility the town does not assume any liability for damage to the equipment removed and stored pursuant to this subsection any permittee whose pay telephones has been removed and stored by the town pursuant to this subsection may reclaim said pay telephones after payment to the town of the total costs incurred for its removal and storage 8 permittee shall within thirty 30 days after prior written request is given by the building department seek permission from the public service commission to restrict the pay telephone to outgoing calls permittee shall restrict the calls to outgoing calls within ten 10 days after receiving permission from the public service commission to do so  82498 free of charge calls  posting rates  refund information a all pay telephones shall permit the following calls to be placed free of charge 1 calls to the 911 emergency number  2 emergency calls placed assistance to the police and fire departments  b current local coin call initial rates shall be posted on the pay telephone or on the pay telephone enclosure and shall not exceed the amount established by the public service commission c an instruction card containing information regarding refunds and type of calls which may be made from a pay telephone shall be posted on a conspicuous place on the pay telephone or on the pay telephone enclosure  82498 compliance required for existing pay telephones  existing agreements exempt all existing pay telephones shall comply with the requirements of this article within sixty 60 days of its effective date however those pay telephones installed pursuant to an existing agreement with the town need not comply with the provisions of this article until the expiration date of said existing agreements any pay telephones not in compliance by the date prescribed hereinabove shall be removed in accordance with the procedure outlined in this article  82498 nuisances footnotes  1 i  in general depositing throwing litter rubbish debris etcprohibited  removal a it shall be unlawful for any person to intentionally scatter any litter rubbish or debris or to throw or permit to be deposited or scattered the same upon any public property these prohibitions to not apply to lawful placement of garbagerefuse as may be authorized under of the town b all lands in the town shall be kept free from litter rubbish debris and vegetation including trees or any other matter which by reason of height proximity to neighboring structures physical condition or other peculiar characteristics might in time of hurricane winds prevalent in this region cause injury to life or damage property within the immediate area surrounding such region the existence of any litter rubbish debris vegetation or other matter as shall create such a hazard is declared to be a public nuisance and a violation of this  cross reference illegal disposal of garbage etc  917  licenses permits and business regulations ch 11  subdivisions ch 175 samenotice  lien it shall be the duty of the chief of police to notify any person who commits a nuisance as defined in section 121 if he can be found if he cannot be found then a copy of the notice shall be mailed to his last known address if any and a copy posted upon the lot or land of the person requiring him to abate such nuisance if such person does not abate the nuisance within ten 10 days after notice and opportunity to be heard the town council may by its duly authorized agent abate such nuisance at its expense and shall have a lien on such lot or land for the amount so expended together with interest at the legal rate from the date of such expenditure the lien shall be enforced as provided by law for the enforcement of special assessment liens  abatement procedures a all property and structures including all swale areas which contain conditions that constitute a serious threat to the public health safety and welfare or which are improperly maintained as required under this the extent that the property or structure constitute a hazard or an otherwise dangerous or unsightly condition is hereby declared to be a public nuisance and shall be abated by the town by repair andor rehabilitation or demolition in accordance with the following procedure 1 when the code inspector determines that any property or structure constitutes a public nuisance defined above or as in any other section of the town the code inspector shall notify the owner of the property or structure of the violations and the repairs or other actions which are necessary to bring the property or structure into compliance with town proceedings to correct andor abate nuisances shall generally be conducted in accordance with article iv code of enforcement of chapter 2 administration of the town ordinances 2 upon a finding by the special magistrate that a nuisance exists and the issuance of a nuisance abatement order the town may proceed to abate said nuisance 3 if the town abates any nuisance the actual cost thereof shall be billed to the owner in the same manner as provided for in section one 1 above the bill shall state that the amount due must be paid within twentyone 21 days of the billing date which date shall be reflected on the bill 4 if the owner fails or refuses to pay the full amount due the costs incurred by the town may be assessed against the property as authorized by section 125 hereinbelow all assessments shall be paid in full no later than the close of town business on the twentyfirst 21 st  day after the property owner has received notice of the assessment thereafter the unpaid amount of the assessment will accrue interest at the maximum rate allowed by law b the provisions of this section are not exclusive and are available to the town in addition to any other remedies andor penalties provided by state statute town ordinance or by this chapter c the town shall have the right to seek a civil injunction against the owner andor occupant of the property or structure for any violation of this chapter  12714 notice of assessment upon completion of the abatement of a nuisance undertaken by the town the town shall notify in writing the property owner that a special assessment has been imposed on the property the notice shall be delivered to the owner and if applicable the agent custodian lessee or occupant in the manner set forth delivery of the notice of violation in section 257 of the town ordinances the notice of assessment shall set forth the following a a description of the violation a description of the actions taken by the town to abate the nuisance and the fact that the property has been assessed for the costs incurred by the town in abating the nuisance  b the aggregate amount of such costs and an itemized list of such costs  c the intent of the town to place the assessment on the tax bill as a nonad valorem assessment if not paid by june 1 st   d the potential for the property to be subject to the sale of a tax certificate bearing interest at a rate as high as eighteen 18 percent per annum if the nonad valorem assessment is not paid as part of the tax bill on the property  and e the potential for the property to be sold and conveyed by tax deed if the tax certificate is not redeemed by payment of the nonad valorem assessment in full plus interest as required by florida law  12714 assessments for abatement of nuisances a establishment of special assessment district the town of lantana in its entirety as its town boundaries exist of the date of enactment of this section and as they may be expanded or contracted from time to time is hereby declared a special assessment district for the purposes of abating nuisances prohibited by this chapter or town properties within the towns boundaries as they may exist from time to time may be assessed for the costs incurred by the town in abating nuisances prohibited by this chapter or town b levy of nonad valorem assessments there is hereby levied and the town council is authorized to levy from time to time a non advalorem assessment against each and every property in the town i on which there occurs or has occurred a violation of this chapter or town ii the town undertakes or has undertaken action pursuant to this chapter or town abate the nuisance and thereby incurs or has incurred costs and iii the property owners fails or refuses or has failed or refused for whatever reason to pay timely the amount owed to the town under this chapter or town the costs incurred by the town in carrying out such abatement the assessment for the abatement of a nuisance shall constitute a lien upon the parcels so assessed equal in rank and dignity with the liens of all state county district or municipal taxes and nonad valorem assessments except as otherwise provided by law such lien shall be superior in dignity to all other liens titles and claims until paid the lien for the nuisance abatement assessment shall be deemed perfected upon adoption by the town council of its annual resolution and shall attach to the property included on the assessment roll as of the prior january 1 the lien date for ad valorem taxes c collection of nonad valorem assessments the town council elects to use the uniform method to impose and collect nonad valorem assessments against properties on which nuisances occur or have occurred the nonad valorem assessments collected pursuant to this chapter will be included in the combined notice of ad valorem taxes and nonad valorem assessments as provided in fs   nonad valorem assessments collected pursuant to this section are subject to all collection provisions in fs   including provisions relating to discount for early payment prepayment by installment method deferred payment penalty for delinquent payment and issuance and sale of tax certificates and tax deeds for nonpayment d agreement to reimburse palm beach county property appraiser and palm beach county tax collector in order to utilize the uniform method for the levy collection and enforcement of the nonad valorem assessments the town is authorized to enter into a written agreement with the palm beach county property appraiser and the palm beach county tax collector for the reimbursement of their costs incurred in the administration and collections of the nonad valorem assessments levied under this chapter e annual nonad valorem assessment roll each year the town council will approve a nonad valorem assessment roll at a public hearing between january 1 and september 15 the nonad valorem assessment roll will be comprised of properties that have had levied against them nonad valorem assessments under this chapter and such assessments have not otherwise been paid in full prior to approval of the roll the finance director is authorized and directed each year i to prepare the notice that must be provided as required by fs   and ii to prepare and publish the notice required by fs    12714 secs 1261215  reserved article ii  noise purpose the intent and purpose of this article is to eliminate regulate and restrict sources and occurrences of noise and disturbances which interfere with the peaceful enjoyment of residential property and which are contrary to public welfare and constitute a nuisance to the public at large  51286 definitions ambient noise means the allencompassing noise associated with a given environment being a composite of sounds from many sources at a given location certain zoning districts therefore will have varying ambient noise levels associated with the uses permitted in such districts loud and raucous noise means any sound which because of its volume level duration and character disturbs injures or endangers the comfort health peace or safety of reasonable persons of ordinary sensibilities within the limits of the town this term includes the kinds of noise generated by the activities enumerated in section 1219 whenever such loud noise is also raucous as characterized by noises accompanying roughsounding harsh boisterous and disorderly qualities  12803 editors note  adopted dec 8 200 repealed  1217 in its entirety and enacted new provisions to read as herein set out prior to amendment  1217 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted   and  adopted dec 12 1994 noise limitations  generally it shall be unlawful for any person to cause or create any loud and raucous noise which disturbs injures or endangers the comfort health peace or safety of reasonable persons of ordinary sensibilities anywhere within the town the term disturbs shall be interpreted objectively to mean that there is an actual or imminent interference with peace or good order or that the noise would unreasonably disturb the peace and quiet of persons in the vicinity thereof the phrase loud and raucous shall be interpreted objectively by considering the volume intensity and duration of the noise  whether the noise is usual or unusual for the location  and the volume and intensity of the ambient noise at the location additionally the fact that the property from which the noise originates is adjacent to a waterfront area shall be a factor for consideration as to whether a neighborhood is being unreasonably impacted by noise ie whether such sounds are audible across the water in residentially zoned neighborhoods situated across the water from commercially zoned waterfront businesses due to unbroken air spaces across the span of water and the unique characteristics of the transmission of sound across water surfaces alleged noise violations shall be reviewed in accordance with a reasonable person standard  12803 editors note  adopted dec 8 200 repealed  1218 in its entirety and enacted new provisions to read as herein set out prior to amendment  1218 pertained to noise limitations and derived from  adopted   and  adopted dec 12 1994 prohibitions  categories of noise prohibitions special regulations for mixed use zoning districts the following activities are prohibited when such are found to unreasonably disturb the peace and quiet of persons in the audible vicinity thereof in addition a rebuttable presumption exists that the ambient noise level of the town is reduced during the hours of  pm and  am on weekdays and saturdays and on sundays between the hours of  am and  midnight  and the ambient noise level at the time the noise is created shall be considered in an objective determination as to whether the noise levels are loud and raucous causing actual or imminent interference with the general peace and good order a commercial industrial manufacturing and construction noise it shall be unlawful for any commercial industrial construction or manufacturing activities to be conducted within the town in such a manner that the noise resulting from such activity is determined to be unreasonably loud and raucous and the reasonableness of such commercial industrial construction or manufacturing noise will be determined in part based upon the rebuttable presumption that the ambient noise level of the town is significantly reduced within the residential zoning districts r1a r1 r3 and r15 during the hours of  pm and  am on weekdays and during the hours of  pm and  am on saturdays and sundays and on designated town holidays and for all other zoning districts during the hours of  pm and  am furthermore in determining whether unreasonably loud and raucous noise is associated with specific construction activities the reasonableness of the noise will be determined in part based upon the presumption that such construction noise is normally associated with work done between the hours of  am and  pm finally all such activities addressed in this subsection shall be conducted in a controlled manner so as not to create unreasonably loud raucous jarring and disturbing noise or any like noise which is a nuisance to persons within the area of audibility b noise from buildings premises or property no person owning or in possession or control of any building or premises shall use the same or rent the same to be used for any business or employment or residential use or for the purpose of pleasure or recreation if such use shall by its nature be loud and raucous and thereby unreasonably disturb the peace of the neighborhood in which such building or premises is situated c radios electronic audio equipment and musical instruments no person shall use operate or play any radio phonograph stereo set tape player television set sound amplifier or other electronic audio device or any musical instrument whether amplified or not which produces or reproduces sound in such a manner as to cause loud and raucous noise and thereby unreasonably disturbs the peace of the neighborhood in which such building or premises is situated the reasonableness of the musical soundnoise will be determined in part based upon the rebuttable presumption that the ambient noise level of the town is reduced between the hours of  pm and  am unreasonable noise caused by operation of radios or other mechanical soundmaking devices within a motor vehicle shall be regulated by the provisions of state law as set forth at fs   d noisy and boisterous conduct it shall be unlawful to knowingly and willfully cause or create loud and raucous noise by engaging in boisterous jarring noisy and loud conduct while upon a public street sidewalk or parkway so as to unreasonably disturb the quiet comfort or repose of persons in any office store dwelling hotel motel or residence within the area of audibility e nuisance by noise emitted by animals it shall be unlawful for any person owning or having custody of any animal domestic or otherwise to permit such animal to create a nuisance by making loud and raucous noises which unreasonably disturb the peace and quiet of the neighborhood f noise determinations within the mixed use zoning districts in making determinations as to whether violations regarding the abovereferenced prohibitions a e have occurred in the mixed use zoning districts as defined at sections 2310123104 the nature of this type of zoning district representing a uniquely planned mix of uses to provide for residential commercial and business uses situated in close proximity to each other shall be considered as an additional factor in the determination as to the reasonableness of the noise created furthermore the fact of the placement of the mw waterfront mixed use district adjacent to the waterfront shall also be a factor for consideration as to which neighborhoods are being unreasonably impacted by noises created within the mw district ie whether such sounds are audible across the water in other zoning districts situated across from the mw district due to the unbroken air spaces across the span of water and the unique characteristics of the transmission of sound across such water surfaces  12803   11116 editors note  adopted dec 8 200 repealed  1217 in its entirety and enacted new provisions to read as herein set out prior to amendment  1217 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted   and  adopted dec 12 1994 state law reference similar provisions fs  351033a exemptions the provisions of this article shall not apply to 1 sound emitted from the operation of motor vehicles legally operating on any public rightofway which are regulated by florida statutes uniform traffic control law  provided however that this exemption shall not operate to exempt any soundemitting device which may be physically attached to any motor vehicles such as radios amplifiers loudspeakers or other similar devices 2 any noise generated by interstate motor and rail carriers and aircraft or airport operations any other subjects to the extent preempted by applicable state or federal laws or regulations 3 any noise generated as a result of emergency work or for the purpose of alerting persons to the existence of any emergency 4 any noise generated by any public speaking or public assembly activities conducted in accordance with a duly authorized license or permit o1286  2 51286 enforcement procedure a the procedure for enforcing the provisions of this article shall be as follows 1 if the noise level is determined to be in violation of this article the appropriate town official shall give a warning to the person persons andor entity responsible for the unreasonably loud and raucous noise 2 if the unreasonably loud and raucous noise is not abated within a reasonable time after warning a notice of violation by the appropriate town official shall be issued b this article may be enforced by citation to the code enforcement board or special magistrate andor other lawful means available to the town to regulate unreasonably loud and raucous noises existing in violation of this article no one 1 means of enforcement shall be the exclusive remedy  12803   12819 editors note  adopted dec 8 200 repealed  1221 in its entirety and enacted new provisions to read as herein set out prior to amendment  1221 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted   and  adopted dec 12 1994 variance procedure any person desiring to be exempt from the provisions of this article may apply for a variance in order to allow the creation of noise that would otherwise be in violation of this article the town council may grant a variance upon a showing by the applicant that 1 additional time is necessary for the applicant to alter or modify the activity in order to comply with the provisions of this article  or 2 the activity operation or noise source will be a temporary duration and cannot be done in a manner that would comply with the provisions of this article  and 3 no reasonable alternative is available to the applicant any variance granted pursuant to this section shall contain thereon all conditions upon which such variance has been granted including but not limited to the effective date time of day location sound level limit or equipment limitation and duration of variance  51286 secs 12231230  reserved article iii  lots and lands clearing footnotes  2  cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 6  excavation of land procedure  651 et seq permitting accumulation of refuse  nuisance it shall be unlawful for the owner or occupant of any lot or piece of ground in the town to suffer or permit any stagnant water filth refuse matter animal or vegetable or any putrid or unwholesome substance to accumulate thereon or to suffer or permit any stable hen house dog kennel or any place where any animals are kept or any water closet or septic tank thereon to become in such a condition as to emit offensive odors and be injurious or dangerous to the health of the neighborhood any such condition above described is hereby declared to be a nuisance and the same shall be abated  trash and weeds  declared nuisance deposit of accumulated trash of whatever nature growth of weeds grass or other vegetative matter which exhibits an unkempt appearance or which exceeds twelve 12 inches in height or a rank vegetable growth which exhales unpleasant or noxious odors or high or rank vegetable growth that may conceal filthy deposits or which is conducive to harboring vermin or other harmful creatures upon any lot piece or parcel of land within the town is hereby declared to be a nuisance    1o2593 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 weeds and undergrowth nuisances it shall be unlawful for any occupant owner or agent of any lot or piece of land in this town to suffer or permit any weeds undergrowth or brush to grow or remain on such lot or piece of land or on the street or alley abutting thereon so as to be or become dangerous or detrimental to the health or safety of the inhabitants and the commission of any of the acts herein prohibited is declared to be a nuisance and shall be abated  reserved editors note  adopted  repealed  1234 which pertained to surveys of real property by town manager  notice to abate and derived from the  1224 and adopted  reserved editors
