92595   1o2896   3 92297   121100   42505   1807 optional forms of benefits a each member entitled to a normal or early retirement benefit shall have the right at any time prior to the date on which the benefit begins to elect to have the benefit payable under any of the options hereinafter set forth in lieu of the benefits provided above and to revoke any such elections and make a new election at any time prior to the actual commencement of payment a firefighter may not make any change in retirement option after the date of cashing or depositing the first retirement check b the value of option benefits shall be the actuarial equivalent of the value of benefits otherwise payable and the present value of payments to the retiring member must be at least equal to fifty 50 percent of the total present value of payments to the retiring member and his beneficiary the member shall make an election by written request to the board such request being retained in the boards files the options available to the members of the fund are as follows 1 joint and survivor option the member may elect to receive a benefit during his lifetime and have such a benefit one hundred 100 percent seventyfive 75 percent or sixtysix and twothirds 66 23  percent or fifty 50 percent of such monthly benefit continued after his death to and during the lifetime of a dependent joint pensioner the election of option 1 shall be null and void if the designated beneficiary dies before the members payments commence 2 life annuity the member may elect to receive a benefit payable for the firefighters life only 3 other in lieu of the other optional forms enumerated in this section benefits may be paid in any form approved by the board so long as it is the actuarial equivalent of the benefits otherwise payable  92892   81400 discharged members members entitled to a pension shall not forfeit the same upon dismissal from the department but shall be retired as herein described  92892 pension validity the board of trustees shall have the power to examine into the facts upon which any pension shall have been granted or obtained erroneously fraudulently or illegally for any reason the board is empowered to purge the pension rolls of any person granted a pension under proper or existing law or granted under this ordinance if the pension is found to be erroneous fraudulent or illegal for any reason  and to reclassify any pensioner who has under any prior or existing law or who shall hereafter under this ordinance be erroneously improperly or illegally classified  92892 incompetence if any member or beneficiary is a minor or is in the judgment of the board otherwise incapable of personally receiving and giving a valid receipt for any payment due them from the fund the board may unless and until claims have been made by a duly appointed guardian or committee of such person make such payment or any part thereof to such persons spouse children parent or other person deemed by the board to have incurred expenses or assumed responsibility for the expenses of such person any payments so made shall be a complete discharge of any liability under the system for such payment  92892 rights and benefits not subject to legal process the rights and benefits provided for herein are vested rights or participants in the fund and shall not be subject to attachment garnishment execution or any other legal process except that pursuant to a court support order the trustees may direct that retirement benefits be paid for alimony or child support  92892 responsibility of the town the town shall have no responsibility for the administration or operation of the fund except as specified herein and shall bear no expenses in the operation of the fund except as required by state law and as specified herein  92892 previous participants the rights of all firefighters previously employed by the town and eligible to receive benefits from those funds previously received by this fund shall be governed by and calculated pursuant to this division and any applicable resolutions or amendments  92892 lump sum payment of small retirement income notwithstanding any provision of the fund to the contrary if the monthly retirement income payable to any person entitled to benefits hereunder is less than one hundred dollars $10000 or if the singlesum value of the accrued retirement income is less than five thousand dollars $500000 as of the date of retirement or termination of service whichever is applicable the board of trustees in the exercise of its discretion may specify that the actuarial equivalent of such retirement income be paid in lump sum  92892   81400 share accounts a individual participant accounts a separate account shall be established and maintained in each participants name effective on or after  pursuant to 13 florida statutes each individual participant account shall be credited with a share of fifty 50 percent of the monies received from tax revenues in june 1993 such monies shall be credited to the individual participant account in an amount directly proportionate to the number of pay periods for which the firefighter was paid compared to the total number of pay periods for which all firefighters were paid counting the pay periods in the calendar year preceding the date for which the tax revenues were received thereafter one hundred 100 percent of the tax revenues shall be allocated to the defined benefit portion of the plan in accordance with section 14101a employee contributions shall be credited to each individual participant share account in the same percentage as set forth in section 14101b b annual adjustment of accounts 1 at the end of each fiscal year each individual account shall be adjusted to reflect the earnings or losses resulting from investments as well as reflecting the costs fees and expenses of administration 2 the investment earnings or losses credits to the individual participant accounts shall be in the same percentage as are earned or lost by the total investment earnings or losses of the fund as a whole unless the board dedicates a separate investment portfolio for the share accounts in which case the investment earnings or losses shall be measured by the investment earnings or losses of the separate investment portfolio 3 costs fees and expenses of administration shall be debited from the individual participant accounts on a proportionate basis taking the costs fees and expenses of administration of the fund as a whole multiplied by a fraction the numerator of which is the total assets in all individual participant accounts and the denominator of which is the assets of the fund as a whole the proportionate share of costs fees and expenses shall be debited to each individual participant account on a pro rata basis in the same manner as tax revenues are credited to each individual participant account ie based on pay periods 4 if the entire balance of the individual participant account is withdrawn before the end of the fiscal year there shall be no adjustment made to the individual participant account to reflect either investment earnings or losses costs fees and expenses of administration c eligibility for benefits any participant who terminates employment with the town upon his or her application filed with the board shall be entitled to be paid one hundred 100 percent of the value of his or her individual participant account provided the participant meets any of the following criteria 1 the participant is eligible to receive early or normal retirement benefits as provided in section 14106a or b  or 2 the participant is eligible to receive disability retirement benefits as provided in section 14106c 3 death benefits are payable on account of the death of a participant who has at least ten 10 years of credited service as provided in section 140106d d forfeitures any firefighter who terminates employment with the town and who does not meet any of the criteria for benefits as set forth in section 14115c hereinabove and who has less than ten 10 years credited service with the town shall be eligible to receive from the fund within ninety 90 days following such termination the total of his own contributions plus interest any other monies allocated to the individual participant share account shall be forfeited and redistributed to the other individual participant accounts e payment of benefits the normal form of payment of the share account benefit shall be a lumpsum payment of the entire balance of the firefighters individual participant account  or upon the written election of the participant on a form prescribed by the board payment shall be made in the same form and at the same time as retirement or disability benefits are paid f death of participant if a participant dies and is eligible for benefits from the individual participant account the entire balance of the individual participant account shall be paid in a lump sum to the beneficiary or beneficiaries designated in accordance with b  92892   92595 pick up of employee contributions effective the first day of the first full payroll period of the first calendar quarter following receipt of a favorable determination letter from the internal revenue service the town shall pick up the member contribution required by this section the contributions so picked up shall be treated as employer contributions in determining tax treatment under the united states internal revenue town shall pick up the member contributions from funds established and available for salaries which fund would otherwise have been designated as member contributions and paid to the pension fund member contributions picked up by the town pursuant to this subsection shall be treated for purposes of making a refund of members contributions and for all other purposes of this and other laws in the same manner and to the same extent as member contributions made prior to the effective date of this subsection the intent of this subsection is to comply with section 414h 2 of the internal revenue  92892 defined retirement option plan drop a eligibility to participate in the drop 1 any active firefighter who is eligible for normal retirement and who can perform the full scope of duties assigned to a firefighter may elect to participate in the drop 2 total years of participation in the drop may not exceed five 5 years 3 election to participate in the drop precludes firefighters from accruing any additional benefit under the fund credited service and average final compensation under the fund freezes as of the date the firefighter elects to participate in the drop 4 upon commencement of participation in the drop the firefighter shall not be eligible for disability retirement or death benefits from the fund b amounts payable upon election to participate in drop 1 monthly retirement benefits that would have been payable had the firefighter terminated employment and elected to receive monthly pension payments will be paid into the drop  payments in to the drop will be made monthly over the period the firefighter participates in the drop up to a maximum of sixty 60 months 2 payments to the drop earn interest credited quarterly at a rate equal to the actual net investment return of the assets in which such payments are invested by the board of trustees however if a firefighter does not terminate employment at the end of participation in the drop monthly payments to the drop and interest credits shall cease 3 termination of employment upon termination of employment firefighters in the drop will receive the balance of hisher drop account in accordance with the following rules  provided however that at all times the drop shall be subject to the provisions of the internal revenue a firefighters may defer payment of drop until the latest day under 3c below or elect to begin to receive payment upon termination of employment b payments shall be made in either a lump sum installments or an actuarially equivalent annuity if the firefighter elects to receive payments in installments or an actuarially equivalent annuity a written election must be made within the specified election period determined by the board and on a form prescribed by the board c any form of payment selected by a firefighter must comply with the minimum distribution requirements of irc a9 eg payments must commence by age seventy and onehalf 7012 d no payments will be made from drop until the firefighter terminates employment e if the firefighter dies before payments from drop begin the beneficiary of the firefighter shall have the same rights as the firefighter  92595 repeal or termination of fund the plan shall remain in effect until the final benefit payment has been made to the last participant or beneficiary and shall then be terminated in accordance with fs    112403 editors note  adopted dec 24 200 repealed  14118 in its entirety and enacted new provisions to read as herein set out prior to amendment  14118 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted sept 28 1992  and  adopted sept 25 1995 police reserve officers footnotes  1  cross reference officers and employees  231 et seq  alcoholic beverages ch 3  forfeiture of vehicles and apparatus used in transportation or removal of or concealment of any illegal liquor  35  nudity on premises where alcoholic beverages are offered for sale prohibited  36  animals ch 4  certain conduct prohibited on public beaches  518  nuisances ch 12  personnel ch 14  police relief and pension fund  1476 et seq  casualty insurance premium tax levied for police officers pension fund  1836  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 17  traffic and motor vehicles ch 19  vehicles for hire ch 22 reserve police force created  under direction of chief of police in order to provide for the pubic safety to provide for better and more efficient law enforcement to provide assistance for regular police officers of the town in the performance of their duties and to provide a trained reserve of police officers to serve the town in time of emergency there is hereby created and established a reserve police force for the town the reserve police force shall be under the supervision direction and control of the chief of police  applications for membership in reserve  qualifications and examination of applicants applications for membership in the reserve police force shall be made to the chief of police the applicant shall have such qualifications and take such examinations as may be prescribed from time to time by state law the chief of police shall investigate the character and reputation of applicants for membership in the reserve police  preparation of eligible list for reserves  certification of names to chief of police every applicant found to be physically mentally and morally fit for service in the reserve police force under the provisions of section 152 shall be placed upon an eligibility list to be kept by the town manager and the name of such person shall be certified to the chief of police of the town  appointment of reserve members the chief of police shall appoint with the approval of the town manager from the names appearing on the eligibility list described in section 153 reserve police officers to serve in the reserve police force  oath of reserves before entering upon his duties as a reserve police officer of the town each officer shall take oath before the town clerk that he will uphold and defend the constitution of the united states and of this state and that he will enforce the provisions of this other ordinances of the town and all lawful orders rules or regulations promulgated under authority of the charter and ordinances of the town  reserve training and active duty reserve police officers may be called from time to time by the chief of police for training in service with the regularly employed police officers of the town they shall also be subject to call for active duty at such times and places within the town as the chief of police may deem necessary in order to fully protect life and property within the town  powers and duties of reserve while on duty under the orders of the chief of police reserve police officers shall possess all of the powers and perform all of the duties and functions of members of the regular police force of the town  uniforms and insignia for reserves when called for training in service or for active duty reserve police officers shall wear such identifying uniform and insignia as may be prescribed from time to time by the chief of police it shall be unlawful for any reserve police officer to wear such identifying uniform and insignia except while on duty it shall also be unlawful for any reserve police officer to attempt to enforce any provision of this other town ordinances or to carry out any order rule or regulation of the town while such reserve police officer is not wearing such identifying uniform and insignia  probation of reserve officers  training  regulation by police chief the chief of police shall prescribe and establish a training program for reserve police officers and in addition may prescribe and establish training programs for reserve police officers the chief of police shall have authority to make such rules regarding training discipline duties and employment of reserve police officers not inconsistent herewith as he may deem necessary reserve police officers shall be deemed to serve at the pleasure of the chief of police and may be discharged or suspended by the chief of police at any time and without cause  signs and advertising footnotes  1 16 pertained to similar subject matter for a detailed history of the provisions for former ch 16 see the table article i  in general definitions the following phrases words and terms shall have the following meanings and basic limitations address words andor numerals indicating the location of a structure use or tenant an address depicted in words or numerals in excess of eight 8 inches in height is construed to be a sign for purposes of administering and enforcing this article for nonsingle family residential structures advertising structure a structure erected or intended for advertising purposes with or without advertising purposes thereon awning a structure projecting from the exterior wall of a building typically constructed of nonrigid materials except for the supporting framework balloon a container typically constructed of nonrigid material filled with air or gas see article iii prohibited signs banner see signbanner building any structure constructed for the support enclosure shelter or protection of persons or personal property  the term includes the word structure and shall be construed as being followed by or any portion thereof building official the chief administrative officer of the town building department or designee canopy rooflike structure generally selfsupporting and freestanding which may be attached to a principal structure providing shade and weather protection typically utilized over drivegasoline pumps clear vision triangle see sight triangle copy written or graphic material which is placed displayed depicted or otherwise indicated on a sign establishment a place of commercial or enterprise with its furnishing and staff the term also includes business and business establishment facade the entire building front including the parapet flag a piece of material typically cloth on which is depicted a national state municipal governmental agency civil or house of worship symbol nautical symbol commercial name information or logo or internationally recognized symbol frontage the length of the front property line of any one 1 business premises grade average finished ground level of a parcel on which a sign is located graphics copy logo color use or combination thereof as determined by the building official to comprise or be part of a sign logo copy or graphics depicting the name trademark or symbol of a use tenant business or business entity association development or project lot a parcel of real property as defined in chapter 175 subdivision and platting regulations of the lantana roof a roof having two 2 slopes on all four 4 sides with the lower slope almost vertical and the upper almost horizontal includes mansard roofs used as an architectural decor but not an integral part of the roof structure major rightofway an abutting public rightofway which has the greatest vehicular design capacity or current traffic volume relative to all other abutting public rightsofway marquee any hood awning or canopy of permanent construction which projects from the wall face of a building memorial see monument monument a structure typically permanent paying homage to glorifying andor memorializing an individual group activity or political or social movement which has no advertising purpose  also known as a memorial mural a graphic or artwork displayed on the exterior of a building that covers all or substantially all of the wall which must consist of a scene depicting natural surroundings indigenous to florida or having historical significance to the town of lantana and is provided for the purpose of decoration or artistic expression a mural may be a painting a fresco or a mosaic since the mural area shall not be counted toward the total sign area allowed on any property a mural may not contain advertising messages and will be reviewed and approved by the town with regard to its graphic and artistic qualities as such elements contribute to the aesthetic quality of the town of lantana the mural shall be reviewed by the town to provide for conformance to the above content requirements while also providing for harmonious colors texture and lines designed to make a substantial contribution to the overall neighborhood streetscape the approval process for a proposed mural is set forth at section 1627 parapet a false front or wall extension above the roof lines pennant a long narrow relatively small flag often triangular used for signaling or for identification see article iii prohibited signs planned commercial development pcd a land area a minimum of one 1 acre in size under unified control designed and planned to be developed as one 1 parcel to accommodate more than one 1 commercial use may utilize prescheduled development phases planned industrial development pid a land area a minimum of one 1 acre in size under unified control designed and planned to be developed as one 1 parcel to accommodate more than one 1 industrial use in the industrial i district may utilize prescheduled development phases shopping center a group of commercial retail and service establishments planned developed managed and operated as a unit with offstreet parking provided on the property and related in its location size and type of establishments to the trade area which the unit serves sight triangle or clear vision triangle the triangular area designated to be kept clear for visibility from automobiles which is formed by a diagonal line connecting two points on the street rightofway lines located twentyfive 25 feet from the intersection of street rightofway lines or a rightofway line and the edge of a driveway and from two 2 feet above the ground to nine 9 feet above the ground no visual obstructions such as landscaping or signage except for traffic control signs installed by the town or other governmental agency shall encroach in this area sign an identification description depiction illustration or device which directs attention to a product service place activity person institution or business  or any emblem painting banner pennant placard or temporary sign designed to advertise identify or convey information the following numbered definitions identify specific types of signs 1 aframe see sidewalk or sandwich sign 2 advertising a sign or sign structure situated upon or attached to real property including the improvements thereon intended for advertising purposes and to aid directly or indirectly in the sale use or promotion of a product commodity service activity or entertainment or to aid directly or indirectly in the sale of real or personal property 3 animated a sign which moves or changes color see article iii prohibited signs 4 announcing a sign announcing a project to be under construction or an intended use of the premises in the immediate future 5 awning a sign incorporated into painted on or attached to an awning 6 banner a sign made of cloth fabric paper nonrigid plastic or similar type of material generally prohibited except as allowed by section 1667 7 bench any sign painted onor attached to a bench 8 billboard any sign andor framework thereof usually placed on a freestanding structure for the purpose of advertising or directing attention to a business commodity service entertainment or attraction sold offered or existing elsewhere than upon the same lot or premises where such sign is located and made available to national andor local advertisers see offpremises sign 9 building identification a sign located on a building facade identifying the building by name 10 canopy a sign incorporated into painted on or attached to a canopy 11 changeable copy a sign other than a time or temperature sign designed for and displaying copy that is not permanently affixed to or made a part of the sign prohibited except for exceptions listed at subsection 16413 12 construction project a temporary sign identifying an active construction project 13 cube a sign or advertising structure comprised of four 4 faces with copy on three 3 or more faces see article iii prohibited signs 14 directory a sign listing multiple names of tenants of a building or group of buildings 15 directional also known as informational sign or traffic sign a a sign erected by a governmental agency to denote the name of any thoroughfare  to point out the route to any city educational institution public building historic place or hospital or other use facility or attraction  to direct and regulate traffic  and to denote any railroad crossing bridge or other transportation facility for the convenience and safety of the general public  b a notice or symbol as to the time and place of regular civic meetings and activities and services  c an onpremises sign which identifies and provides directions to facilities service areas andor structures located on the premises and which may include copy such as enter caution exit drive parking no trespassing or similar terms andor a directional arrows  with commercial copy limited to logo and business name  or d an onpremises sign identifying the address number or name of a structure and parking areas therefor  with commercial copy limited to logo and business name 16 dualfaced a sign with two 2 faces which are usually but not necessarily parallel 17 flashing any sign which contains a continually window sign see article iii prohibited signs 18 flat a wall sign erected parallel to the facade of any building to which it is attached and supported throughout its entire length by the facade or outside wall of the building 19 gasoline price a sign indicating prices for gasoline and similar petroleum products available onsite 20 ground a freestanding sign which is erected flush to the ground designed to emit artificial sources of artificial light whether or not said lights or tubes are physically attached to sign 23 mansard any sign which is placed on the lower slope of a mansard roof 24 design that are for sale 27 monument a lowprofile freestanding ie not attached to any building for support sign with a solid base located on the ground typically designed to incorporate materials architectural features and design of the principal structures located on the property see section 16101 28 nameplate or owner designation a sign other than a directory sign indicating the name andor profession or address of the person or persons residing on the premises or legally occupying the premises provided that no such sign shall include letters andor other symbols exceeding eight 8 inches in height for nonsingle family residential structures 29 nonconforming a sign or advertising structure legally constructed permitted and existing within the town limits on  which by its design height type content electrical wiring square foot area location use or structural support or otherwise did not conform to the requirements of this chapter on that date 30 occupant identification a sign which advertises or directs attention to the use or establishment located on the premises or a product or service available onpremises 31 offpremises any sign which advertises a use establishment product or service that is sold produced manufactured or furnished at a place other than on the property on which said sign is located also called an outdoor advertising sign or billboard see article iii prohibited signs 32 painted includes murals mosaics and signs painted on any building surface not allowed on roof surface must be professionally designed and painted 33 paper window a temporary sign displayed within glass display windows for promotion of the business conducted therein see article iii prohibited signs 34 parapet a sign attached to and dependent upon the parapet for structural support 35 permanent any sign which when installed is intended for permanent use for the purposes of this chapter any sign with an intended use in excess of twelve 12 months from the date of installation shall be deemed a permanent sign 36 pole a freestanding sign which is supported by one 1 or more poles posts columns pyramids or other extensions from the ground level see article iii prohibited signs 37 political campaign any sign used in connection with a local state or national election campaign  also referred to as a political campaign advertisement 38 portable any sign which is manifestly designed to be transported by trailer or on its own wheels including such signs where the wheels may be removed and the remaining chassis or support structures converted to an a or t frame sign and attached temporarily or permanently to the ground see article iii prohibited signs 39 price see informational sign 40 price rate gas service station see gasoline price sign 41 projecting shall include any sign which is attached to a building or structure and extends beyond the line of the building or structure or beyond the surface of that portion of the building or structure to which it is attached includes signs suspended under a porch or other structural element that would exist with or without the sign 42 public convenience a sign identifying or providing direction to public telephones restrooms and the like 43 public utility a sign identifying the location of underground utility facilities high voltage equipment and the like 44 public warning a sign identifying the location of hazardous or dangerous areas conditions or events 45 real estate a temporary sign erected by the owner or his agent advertising for sale rent or lease the property upon which the sign is located 46 remodeling or contractor a temporary sign designating the name of the general andor subcontractor undertaking the remodeling andor renovation of an existing structure or the construction of a new structure 47 roof a sign erected over across or on the roof of any building which is dependent on the roof parapet or upper walls of any building for support see article iii prohibited signs 48 sidewalk or sandwich a moveable sign not secured nor attached to the ground placed on public or private property visible from a public rightofway where the apparent purpose is to advertise a product service or activity or direct people to a business or activity located on the same or nearby property see article iii prohibited signs 49 snipe a small sign of any material including but not limited to paper cardboard wood or metal which is tacked nailed posted pasted glued or otherwise attached to trees poles fences or other objects see article iii prohibited signs 50 special event a sign which calls attention to a civic event or activity or other similar activity of a temporary nature 51 subdivision entrance a sign designating or identifying a particular residential subdivision or area 52 temporary a sign designated constructed and intended to be used on a short term basis all temporary signs except for municipal service signs must be set back a minimum of ten 10 feet from the rightofway or property line whichever is further from the adjacent roadway 53 threedimensional product display products or representations thereof assembled or designed for display sale or advertising see article iii prohibited signs 54 traffic see directional signs 55 vehicular any sign affixed to a vehicle or trailer for the purpose of advertising see article iii prohibited signs 56 wall a sign erected parallel to the outside wall facade of any structure including flat individual letter or cabinet signs 57 window a permanent or temporary sign which is painted on or displayed upon or within a storefront window or door including decals paper plastic cardboard or other temporary signs sign face the part of a sign that is or may be used for advertising purposes  102703   52404 purpose and scope of regulations a in general the purpose of this chapter is to encourage the effective use of signs as a means of communications in the town  to maintain and enhance the aesthetic environment and the towns ability to attract sources of economic development and growth  to improve pedestrian and traffic safety  to minimize the possible adverse effect of signs on nearby public and private property  to foster the integration of signage with architectural and landscape designs  to enable the fair and consistent enforcement of these sign regulations and to promote the implementation of the towns comprehensive future land use plan additionally this chapter provides for regulations to achieve the following 1 property value protection signs should not create a nuisance to the occupancy or use of other properties as a result of their size height brightness or movement they should be in harmony with buildings the neighborhood and other conforming signs in the area 2 communication signs should not deny other persons or groups the use of sight lines on public rightsofway should not obscure important public messages and should not overwhelm readers with too many messages signs can and should help individuals to identify and understand the jurisdiction and the character of its subareas 3 preservation of communitys beauty small towns such as this which include a public beach as well as small office retail residential and industrial uses rely heavily on their natural surroundings and beautification efforts to retain their economic viability this concern is reflected by the active and objective regulations of the appearance and design of signs b regulations strictly enforced it shall be unlawful for any persons to post display change or erect a sign or sign structure that requires a permit without first having obtained a permit therefor in accordance with section 1621 signs or sign structures erected without a valid permit shall be deemed in violation of this chapter and it shall be mandatory to obtain the applicable permit or remove the sign or sign structure immediately all signs not expressly permitted by this chapter are strictly prohibited c noncommercial message notwithstanding anything contained in subsections a and b above to the contrary any sign erected pursuant to the provisions of this chapter may at the option of the applicant contain either a noncommercial message unrelated to the business located on the premises where the sign is erected or a commercial message related to the business and located on the business premises the noncommercial message may occupy the entire sign face or portion thereof the sign face may be changed from commercial to noncommercial messages as frequently as desired by the owner of the sign provided that the size and design criteria conform to the applicable portions of this chapter the sign is allowed by this chapter the sign conforms to the requirements of the applicable zoning designation and the appropriate permits are obtained for the purposes of this sign code noncommercial messages by their very nature shall never be deemed offpremises  102703 identification label all approved signs shall have affixed thereto and conspicuously displayed in the lower righthand area a sign identification tag or label which shall include the following information 1 permit number  2 date of permit issuance  and 3 name of permittee  102703 license required it shall be unlawful for any person or firm to engage in the business of constructing fabricating erecting altering or maintaining signs within the town unless and until such person or firm shall have a valid occupational license issued by the town and unless and until such person shall have filed with the building official a certificate of public liability and property damage insurance policy executed by a company authorized to do business in the state of florida in a sum of not less than three hundred thousand dollars $30000000 for bodily injury in any one 1 occurrence and not less than fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for damage of property  102703 signs made and installed by licensed contractorpainter all permanent signs must be manufactured constructed fabricated erected altered assembled painted installed and maintained by a licensed sign contractorpainter exceptions to this requirement are as follows temporary signs made and erected by charitable organizations having 501c3 status and used to advertise their special events  and temporary signs made and erected by residential homeowners for their personal use only at the property on which they reside  101005 secs 1661620  reserved article ii  permits required it shall hereafter be unlawful and deemed a prima facie violation of this chapter for any person to place erect or maintain or cause to be placed erected or maintained any sign temporary or permanent or structural alteration thereto without having first obtained a permit in conformance with the provisions of this chapter except as otherwise provided herein any person who commences any work to place erect or cause to place or erect a sign prior to obtaining a permit as required shall be subject to a penalty of two hundred 200 percent of the normal fee in addition to the required permit fee the payment of the required fee plus penalty amount shall not affect the decision of the town to initiate other applicable code enforcement actions against a person related to a violation of the sign code regulations  102703   101005 application all plans and layouts for a sign shall be accompanied by an application which shall be filed with the building official prior to the issuance of any sign permit the application shall be on a form approved by the building official and shall describe and set forth the following 1 the type of sign as defined in this chapter  2 the street address of the property upon which the sign is to be located and the proposed location of the sign on the property  3 the square footage area per sign and message content  4 the name and address of the person or persons in control or possession of the property upon which the sign is to be located the authorization of the property owner is required if a sign is to be erected by anyone other than the owner or agent  5 a sketch blueprint or similar presentation drawn to scale showing the square footage of the sign area as well as the sign face height of letters colors materials lighting equipment if any and the proposed signs position relative to structures andor property lines showing all pertinent structural details wind pressure requirements and display materials in accordance with all requirements of the building code the seal of a florida registered engineer or architect shall be affixed to any sketch blueprint or similar presentation on signs over thirty 30 square feet in area these requirements do not pertain to certain nameplate or owner designation signs real estate temporary contractor and remodeling signs and certain other signs see section 1625 6 such other pertinent information as the building official or council determine to be reasonably necessary to evaluate the application  102703 interpretation in all applications for permits where a matter of interpretation arises the most restrictive definition shall prevail  102703 permit inspection and appeal fees a fee schedule adopted by resolution of the town council shall set forth the necessary fees and charges imposed to cover the administrative costs associated with sign permits deposits reviews appeals and site inspections for the installation andor placement of signs or advertising structures the applicable fee shall accompany the permit or appeal application  102703 signs not requiring permit or permit fees the following signs or types of signs shall be governed by and are subject to all applicable provisions of this chapter however no permit application or fee is required 1 nameplate or owner designation signs when the signs do not exceed two 2 square feet in area nor two 2 feet in width 2 residential real estate signs see subsection 16557 for size requirements 3 credit card signs 4 public convenience signs 5 public utility signs 6 public warning signs 7 flags shall be limited to twentyfour 24 square feet in area per flag and shall not exceed three 3 per parcel lot facility or structure as applicable 8 seasonal displays or decorations not advertising a product or establishment 9 temporary contractor and remodelers signs on active and permitted construction projects see section 1666 for sign requirements 10 nonresidential real estate signs for sale signs rental signs and lease signs see applicable zoning district section for sign requirements 11 addresses depicted in words andor characters not to exceed twelve 12 inches in height 12 refurbishing an existing sign provided the copy and color are not changed  provided that the cost of any repair does not exceed fifty 50 percent of the original cost of the sign  provided the sign remains substantially the same as originally approved  provided that no electrical repairs are necessary except for normal maintenance  and provided it is not nonconforming 13 advertising and identifying signs located on taxicabs buses trailers trucks or vehicle bumpers 14 political campaign signs see section 1653 15 civic religious and public service temporary directional signs which are displayed on the day of the event for no longer than a twentyfour 24 hour period such signs shall be limited to two 2 per event and may be no larger than four 4 square feet each  the top of such signs shall be no higher than three 3 feet from grade  102703 record of ownership and application the building official shall keep on file all sign applications and permits for ready reference as to ownership and periodic inspection  102703 review of application by building official  issuance of permits and inspection a the building official shall upon the filing of an application for a sign or mural permit examine the plans and specifications and other data required hereunder and inspect and examine the premises upon which the sign or structure is proposed to be erected or the mural depicted and determine whether the proposed sign mural andor structure complies with all the requirements of this chapter and all other laws and ordinances of the town additionally the building official shall forward any proposed plans or sketches for a mural to the plan review committee for its review and recommendation to the town council which shall have final approval regarding the painting or fabrication of any proposed mural b upon satisfactory compliance with the requirements herein the building official shall cause a written sign or mural permit to be issued the building official shall issue a nofee permit for a proposed mural in conformance with the approval of such by the town council c after the issuance of a permit the following inspections shall be made by the town at the request of the permit holder 1 a foundation inspection prior to pouring concrete for any freestanding ground sign 2 an electrical inspection for electrical or monument signs 3 a final inspection for completion of the sign or mural in accordance with the approved final plans or sketch of mural secs 16281640  reserved article iii  prohibited signs list of prohibited signs the following signs or types of signs shall be prohibited within the town 1 balloons used for advertising purposes  2 banners with the exception of the following which may be displayed as more particularly set forth in section 1667 a grand opening banners  b banners placed on street light poles by the town as holiday andor seasonal decorations public announcements etc  c sidewalk sale banners  and d banners used as special event signs 3 changeable copy signs with the exception of the following which may be displayed as set forth in this chapter a gasoline price signs located on pump islands or on monument signs  b informational signage located on property zoned public ownership or publicly owned buildings located in other zoning districts  c menu pricing signs  d movie theater marquee signs  e house of worship signs 4 cube signs  5 flashing signs or animated signs  6 illuminated signs in any residential zoning district except for residential nameplate or subdivision signs which may be illuminated with a soft and muted effect  7 offpremises or billboard signs  8 paper window signs  9 pennants  10 pole signs excepting those directional real estate political campaign temporary public convenience public utility public warning remodeling contractor and announcing signs which are permitted herein  11 portable signs  sidewalk signs  sandwich signs  12 roof signs  13 search light promoting advertising or bringing attention to a business enterprise or event  14 snipe signs  swinging signs  15 signs placed attached posted or located on or to any tree utility pole street light sidewalk curb fire hydrant bridge or any other public property except for public utility convenience and warning signs and signs erected by governmental agencies  16 signs created by colored illumination or shadow casting on structures  17 signs placed on bus benches bus shelters or waste receptacles except as may be allowed by contract with the town  18 signs which copy or imitate official signs or which purport to have official status  19 signs which display any obscene or illegal written or graphic message  20 signs which project into or over any dedicated public rightsofway  21 signs which obstruct or interfere with any door fire exit stairway ladder or opening intended to provide light air ingress or egress for any building  22 signs which are not properly maintained or are in dilapidated or hazardous condition the basis of judgment for this determination shall be the specifications as set forth in the building code andor in this chapter as applied by the building official  23 signs which constitute a traffic safety or fire hazard by reason of size location coloring or method of illumination obstruct vision of motorists or pedestrians  and which obstruct or detract from any official traffic control devices  or utilize the word stop look danger or any other word or phrase symbol or character in such a manner as to interfere with mislead or confuse traffic  24 threedimensional product displays including cars appliances animal likenesses or any other object in excess of three 3 feet in length one 1 foot in height and one 1 foot in depth  25 vehicular signs with a total sign area on any vehicle in excess of five 5 square feet when the vehicle a is parked for more than sixty 60 consecutive minutes within fifty 50 feet of any street rightofway  b is visible from the street rightofway that the vehicle is within fifty 50 feet of  and c is not regularly used in the conduct of the business advertised on the vehicle a vehicle used primarily for advertising or for the purpose of providing transportation for owners or employees of the business advertised on the vehicle shall not be considered a vehicle used in the conduct of the business 26 any other sign not specifically permitted by this chapter secs 16421652  reserved article iv  permitted signs political campaign signs a political campaign signs may be displayed in any zoning district not more than thirty 30 days prior to an election political campaign signs shall not exceed six 6 feet in height from grade level six 6 feet in width nor sixteen 16 square feet in area display of political campaign signs shall be limited to two 2 such signs per candidate ballot item andor referendum question for each frontage of a parcel political campaign signs shall not be illuminated b each candidate whether for a federal state county or town office shall remove all of his political campaign advertisements within ten 10 days after 1 withdrawal of his candidacy  2 having been eliminated as a candidate  or 3 being elected to office however a candidate is not expected to remove those political campaign signs which are in the form of signs used by an outdoor advertising business as provided in fs the provisions herein do not apply to political campaign signs and advertisements placed on motor vehicles or to campaign messages designated to be worn by persons c if political campaign advertisements are not removed within the specified period the building official has the authority to remove such advertisements and may charge the candidate the actual cost for such removal funds collected for removing such advertisements shall be deposited to the general revenue fund of the town d no political campaign advertisements shall be erected posted painted tacked nailed or otherwise displayed placed or located on or above any town state or county road rightofway or the fec railroad rightofway e the town clerk before whom a candidate qualifies for office shall notify the candidate in writing of the provisions in this section  102703 gasoline price signage gasoline price signage may only be located at pump islands subject to a maximum price sign area of fifteen 15 square feet per pump island or row which is separated by a vehicular lane from a building or other pump island or row or on a monument sign not to exceed four 4 feet in height from grade gasoline price signs shall incorporate the color scheme and architectural features of the principal structures gasoline price signs may be illuminated see section 1683 for additional illumination requirements  102703 singlefamily multifamily and mobile home residential districts r1a r1 r3 frontage as follows business frontage maximum square footage signage 50 or less 50 51 to 99 75 100 to 150 120 150 and larger one 1 square foot per one 1 linear foot to a maximum of 300 square feet c 16101 mobile home park district mhp residential properties in a mobile home park district shall meet the requirements of section 1655 set forth herein  102703 announcing signs a signs announcing a subdivision or property improvement may be erected on the subject property in any zoning district after the final site plan has been approved 1 for lots up to one hundred 100 feet in width and any lot in the r1 r1a and r3 zoning districts one 1 such sign nonilluminated with one 1 sign face only parallel to the rightofway and not exceeding eight 8 feet in height from grade level eight 8 feet in width and thirtytwo 32 square feet in area 2 for lots between one hundred 100 feet and three hundred 300 feet in width one 1 such sign nonilluminated with one 1 sign face only parallel to the square feet in area b the announcing sign must be removed upon issuance of the last certificate of occupancy for the property c the sign shall be removed if construction of infrastructure or structures has not commenced within ninety 90 days of a final site plan approval or issuance of the building permit unless additional time is allowed by council d announcing signs shall not be illuminated  102703 model sales office signs a one 1 model sales office sign nonilluminated erected to identify a model sales office with one 1 sign face only parallel to the rightofway not to exceed four 4 feet in height above grade level and four 4 square feet in area is allowed per subdivision or neighborhood b model name signs nonilluminated erected to identify various models not exceeding four 4 square feet and not to exceed two 2 feet in height may be erected  102703 remodeling or contractor signs remodeling or contractor signs shall not be illuminated and may only be placed on property after issuance of building permit and may remain until the permit expires or construction is completed whichever occurs first 1 residential zoning districts remodeling or contractor signs with only one 1 face may be placed parallel to the rightofway adjacent to the property during the time of remodeling andor renovation only and such sign shall not exceed four 4 feet in height from grade level and four 4 square feet in area 2 nonresidential zoning districts remodeling or contractor signs with only one 1 face may be placed parallel to the rightofway adjacent to the property during the time of construction remodeling andor renovation only and such sign shall not exceed seven 7 feet in height from grade level and sixteen 16 square feet in area for multiuse or multitenant projects a remodeling or contractor sign may be displayed inside a tenant space window during remodeling or construction of a tenant space outparcels may display one 1 such sign as set forth in this subsection  102703 grand opening signs holiday signs sidewalk sales signs banners special event signs a flags are generally prohibited except for placement limited by size and number as set forth at subsection 16257 banners streamers twirling balloons or other air or gasfilled figure and copy signs are also prohibited  except that by special permit grand opening banners andor flags shall be allowed for a maximum period of fourteen 14 days during the first ninety 90 days from 1 the opening day of a new business  2 the opening day of a business after a change of ownership  andor 3 the completion date of a substantial remodeling of a business premises requiring a building permit having a value of five thousand dollars $500000 or more only one 1 grand opening shall be permitted per 18month period unless legal ownership changes b holiday banners and flags shall be allowed for a period of seven 7 days prior to and six 6 days following a national holiday c banners advertising a permitted sidewalk sale shall be allowed for a maximum of four 4 days from twentyfour 24 hours prior to the start of the sale subject to the following regulations 1 no more than one 1 banner not to exceed sixteen 16 square feet per business location  2 the banner shall be securely fastened to a substantial support on site at the business location and shall not interfere with pedestrian or vehicular traffic or visibility  3 the banner shall not be attached to utility poles or landscaping trees antennae trash receptacles or the like  4 the banner shall be removed immediately after the permitted sidewalk sale ends and said permit expires 5 banners may be placed on street light poles by the town as seasonal decorations public announcements etc from time to time as deemed appropriate e special event signs shall be allowed upon the issuance of a permit for a maximum of fourteen 14 days subject to the following regulations 1 special event signs may not exceed sixteen 16 square feet in surface area except when displayed as window signs in which case the total sign area of all special event signs in any one window may not exceed six 6 square feet and shall be placed to allow for a clear and unobstructed view from outside the building to the interior along a normal line of sight when viewing the cash register and sales transaction area 2 banners used as special event signs are subject to the size and duration restrictions as set forth above and may be attached or fastened only in the manner described at subsection 1667c 3 special event signs meeting all requirements of this chapter may be utilized to call attention to a civic event or other activity of a temporary nature held at that location  102703   52404 temporary seasonal sales signs commercial signage of a temporary nature advertising or promoting the sale of seasonal items such as christmas trees is permitted to be displayed for not more than forty 40 days said temporary seasonal sales signage not to exceed seven 7 feet in height and thirtytwo 32 square feet in area businesses fronting on two 2 or more public rightofways may be permitted a maximum of two 2 such signs businesses located on outparcels may in addition to the above signage allowance display an additional temporary seasonal sales sign facing the interior of the planned commercial development all temporary seasonal sales signs must be removed within seven 7 days following the event a permit is required temporary seasonal sales signs may be illuminated  102703 secs 16691679  reserved article v  construction guidelines height measurement criteria the height of all monument signs shall be calculated from grade  grade is defined as the average finished ground level of a parcel on which a sign is located the heights of monument signs located on berms shall be determined from grade level and not from the top of a berm  102703 sign area criteria a monument and projecting signs the area of a monument or projecting sign shall include the entire area within and enclosed by the exterior perimeter of all cabinets or modules within a single continuous figure including but not limited to all written copy logos symbols decorative embellishments and border or roof treatments this shall include all open areas within said perimeters and all space separating said cabinets and modules only one 1 face the largest of any dualfaced sign shall be counted in calculating sign area b wall signs the area of a wall sign shall include the entire area within a single continuous perimeter composed of a square or rectangle which encloses the extreme limits of all sign elements affixed to the wall andor window including but not limited to cabinet structures written copy logos symbols illustrations decorative embellishments border treatments and painted backgrounds framing the sign element  102703 safety factors pertaining to all signs no sign shall be constructed or erected in such a manner that it will become a hazard to automotive or pedestrian traffic nor shall any sign or lighting of such sign be so placed as to obstruct the vision of the driver of any motor vehicle  102703 construction requirements a structure every sign together with its advertising structure framework braces angles or other supports shall be maintained in a safe condition properly secured supported and braced shall be kept in good structural condition and shall be clean and well painted at all times b support every sign shall be constructed to withstand pressures as set forth in the building code shall be rigidly and firmly braced and shall be securely attached to the building or structure c wood all wood permitted to be used either for new signs for replacements of existing signs or for any part thereof shall be of rot and deteriorationresistant materials d illumination 1 illuminated signs shall have their source of light concealed from view except that where channel letters or figures are used for any sign the illumination thereof may be visible if recessed within the depth of the channel 2 illuminated signs shall have their intensity of illumination approved by the building official before issuance of any permit 3 illuminated signs shall have all exterior electrical outlets terminated in a galvanized box with blank cover which shall be flush with and not protrude beyond the finished surface of the exterior wall 4 illuminated signs shall have all transformer boxes and other accessory equipment placed so that they are not visible from the exterior 5 illuminated signs shall not have electric lights or fixtures attached to them in any manner if they are of wood construction e electrical all illuminated signs shall in addition be subject to the provisions of the electrical code and the town building code and the permit fees required all components used in electrical signs shall be approved by an approved testing laboratory and shall bear its label f requirements see section 1622 for application submittal requirements wall signs a wall signs shall not extend more than eighteen 18 inches from the wall or facade of the building to which they are attached b wall signs shall not extend above the eaves of a building with a pitched roof or the parapet of a building with a flat roof c wall signs shall be fastened directly to the wall by wellsecured metal anchors in such manner as to withstand a fiftypoundpersquarefoot windload secs 16851699  reserved article vi  nonconforming signs defined a any sign legally constructed pursuant to a valid permit and maintained within the town on  or a sign or advertising structure legally constructed pursuant to a valid permit and maintained in an area annexed into the town after  which by its height type area location use or structural support does not conform to the requirements of this chapter shall be termed nonconforming b notwithstanding the above any sign legally constructed pursuant to a valid permit of a type allowed by this chapter with dimensions that are within one hundred ten 110 percent of the dimensional requirements set forth herein shall not be subject to the removal and amortization provisions of section 16101 but shall however be subject to the provisions of section 16103 relating to damage and removal  102703 removal and amortization schedule a all nonconforming signs or advertising structures not meeting the criteria as set forth in subsection 16100b shall be removed or altered so as to conform to the provisions of this chapter by  except for legally permitted freestanding nonpole signs which are exempt from removal and for pole signs which must be made to conform or be removed by  since any such pole signs have been deemed nonconforming from the date of the last revision to the sign code on  and will have had approximately five 5 years in which to realize an amortization of investment prior to the scheduled compliance or removal date of  b all signs which have been erected without benefit of a valid permit and all illegal signs shall be removed immediately c all nonconforming and illegal signs shall be removed at the owners expense  102703 alterations to structure or sign face alterations to the structures or sign faces of nonconforming signs shall be permitted so long as the alterations do not increase or enlarge the nonconforming nature of the sign prior to issuance of a permit to alter a sign structures and sign faces the applicant shall acknowledge that issuance of a permit for alteration of a nonconforming sign structures or sign faces shall not extend or modify the removal and amortization schedule set forth in section 16101 and shall not entitle the sign owner to any reimbursement from the town at the time of removal of the nonconforming sign  102703 damage any nonconforming sign which is destroyed or damaged to the extent of fifty 50 percent or more of the sign and frame structure inclusive as determined by a professional appraisal or is altered or replaced shall not be altered replaced or reinstalled unless and until said sign has been made to conform to all applicable regulations of this  102703 registration of nonconforming signs each owner of any sign hereafter made nonconforming shall register said sign with the building official registration shall include the owners name and address and the sign location  102703 interpretation of conflicting provisions in the event of a conflict between any section sentence or clause this chapter and any other section sentence or clause in this chapter or any other chapter of portion thereof of this or any other town ordinance the more restrictive provision shall apply  102703 secs 1610616119  reserved article vii  enforcement administration and enforcement the requirements of this chapter shall be administered and enforced by the building official andor code enforcement officers of the town andor by any other lawful means  102703 revocation a every permit issued hereafter pursuant to the terms conditions regulations and provisions of this chapter may be revoked at any time by the building official upon the determination of the building official that a particular sign is not in full compliance with the provisions of this chapter  provided however that the building official has notified the owner of such sign in writing of such defect and the owner of such sign has not remedied the defect within the thirty 30 days allowed for the remedy of such defect b in the event the applicant for permit of a sign proposed to be established pursuant to the issuance of a valid permit has failed to construct erect establish or place the sign for which the permit was issued within three 3 months subsequent to the date of the issuance of permit the permit shall automatically lapse and shall be of no further force and effect any individual erecting such sign after the revocation shall be deemed in violation of the terms conditions regulations and provisions of this chapter as if the owner or applicant had never received nor applied for a permit pursuant to the terms of this chapter  102703 inspection of existing signs a upon inspection the building official shall require the owner of any sign found to be in defective condition or which does not comply with the terms conditions and provisions of this article to be repaired or removed within thirty 30 days from the date of notice of such defect  provided however that if the building official shall determine that the maintenance or use of such sign shall adversely affect the public safety he may require the immediate removal at owners expense or prohibit the use of said sign until such defects shall have been remedied b the building official shall have the right upon seven 7 calendar days notice to remove any sign which is not properly maintained shows neglect becomes dilapidated or is otherwise in violation of provisions of this chapter if such sign is found unsafe or hazardous the cost of such removal shall be paid by the owner  102703 person responsible for fee it shall be the responsibility of the owner or other person in control or possession of the real estate upon which any sign or advertising structure is located to keep all signs in good repair and to pay required fees if any failure to pay required fees in a timely manner shall cause such sign to be a violation of this article and subject to removal as set forth at subsection 16101b vacant premises a sign shall be removed by the owner or lessee of the property when the use or business located on the property which the sign identifies or advertises is closed abandoned unoccupied andor the property is vacated within thirty 30 days of closing abandonment or vacancy the building official shall provide written notice to property owners or lessees who fail to remove signage within thirty 30 days notifying the owner or lessee that the building official may remove the subject sign and assess the owner or lessee for the cost of removal  102703 procedure on violations a a violation of any provision of this division shall be a violation of the town ordinances subject to fine injunctive relief code enforcement procedures andor any other enforcement remedy legally available to the town b signs erected without a valid permit andor prior to the issuance of a building permit shall subject the property owner or sign contractor to a fine of up to two hundred fifty dollars $25000 per day per sign c a sign contractor may also be subject to suspension or revocation of the town occupational license for repeated violations of this chapter d failure to pay fines levied for violating this chapter may result in a moratorium on the issuance of sign permits for the violator until the subject fines have been paid in full  102703 appeals a appeal of building official decision regarding proposed signage any person or persons aggrieved by any final action of the building official with respect to proposed signage may file a notice of appeal setting forth the reasons for such appeal appeals must be filed with the town clerk within ten 10 days from the date of formal action by the building official accompanied by the appropriate fee as set by resolution of the town council the filing of any appeal shall suspend the issuance of any building or other required permit until final action has been taken on the appeal a timelyfiled written appeal shall be placed on the next available town council agenda for final determination by the council after affording the appellant a full opportunity to be heard  102703 issuance of permit not approval of violation the issuance of a permit upon plans and specifications shall not be construed to be a permit for or approval of any violation of this chapter nor shall such issuance prevent the building official from thereafter requiring the correction of errors in said plans and specifications or preventing the erection of any sign thereunder when in violation of this chapter  102703 variances a a person seeking a variance to the provisions of this chapter shall file an application with the building official on forms provided by the town which shall include the following information 1 name address and telephone number of petitioner  2 location of building structure or lot to which or upon which the sign or other advertising structure is located or is to be erected  3 position of the sign or proposed sign in relation to nearby buildings andor other structures  4 twentyseven 27 blueprints or inked drawings of the plans and specifications and method of construction and attachment to the building or in the ground  5 justification for granting the variance requested utilizing the criteria for the granting of variances as set forth in subsection c of this section  6 two 2 originals and twentyfive 25 copies of said application shall be submitted building official b within thirty 30 days of the receipt of the complete application and the payment of the required fee together with the costs of public notice a public hearing before the town council shall be scheduled there shall be a publication of notice of the time place and purpose of each hearing placed once in a newspaper of general circulation at least ten 10 days prior to such hearing c the standards to be considered by the town council prior to granting a sign variance are as follows 1 special conditions and circumstances exist which are peculiar to the land on which the sign is proposed and that these conditions andor circumstances are not applicable to other lands in the same zoning district or corridor 2 the special conditions and circumstances do not result from the actions of the applicant 3 the granting of the variance requested will not confer upon the applicant any special privilege that is denied by this chapter to others in the same zoning district or along the same corridor 4 literal interpretations of the provisions of this chapter would deprive the applicant of rights commonly enjoyed by other properties in the same zoning district or corridor under the terms of this chapter and would result in an unnecessary and undue hardship on the applicant 5 the grant of the variance is not contrary to the intent of this chapter will be in harmony with the purpose of this chapter and will not be injurious to the area involved or otherwise detrimental to the public welfare d violations  time limitations violations of such conditions and safeguards as prescribed by the town council when made a part of the terms under which the variance is granted shall be deemed a violation of this chapter and the variance shall be considered void variances shall become void if not exercised within six 6 months of the date granted before this six 6 month period has expired the applicant may make a written request to the town council for an additional six 6 months extension any further extensions of time shall require a new application to be processed as a new case  102703 streets sidewalks and other public places footnotes  1  cross reference   alcoholic beverages ch 3  alcoholic beverages prohibited in inspections all work performed on the public streets or sidewalks shall be inspected by the town engineer or other person designated by the town manager  exemption from county county fair share contribution for road improvements ordinance it is the purpose of this ordinance that a conflict be established as a term used in f between the provisions of this section and known as the fair share contribution for road improvements  enacted by the board of county commissioners of palm beach florida effective  it is the intent of the town council that no portion of said county ordinance shall be applicable within the corporate limits of the town of lantana florida the town of lantana shall not collect the road improvement impact fees as described in the aforesaid county ordinance during the engineer for correct grading and conformity to this chapter before construction is commenced  secs 1741730  reserved article ii  swale areas footnotes  2  editors note  adopted  did not specifically amend this   hence codification of the substantive provisions of the ordinance as art ii  17311736 was at the editors discretion definition as used in this chapter the term swale area shall mean those areas lying between the paved roadway and the sidewalk or between the paved roadway and the rightofway boundary line adjacent to the paved roadway which are the property of the town or over which the town has exclusive control as part of its road and drainage rightofway 1 42886 planting and removal  written approval required no trees shall be planted or removed from the areas except by the town or by private citizens who have obtained the written approval of the building official to plant or remove any tree 2 42886 variety and location a only those trees andor vegetative matter which adhere to or are identified in the south florida water management district xeriscape plant guide no 2 may be planted in swale areas within the town this plant guide is on file with the building official of the town and may be consulted at any time during normal working hours b all trees andor vegetation of any kind whatsoever to be planted in swale areas must be planted in accordance with a site plan approved by the town c no other plantings of trees andor any other type of vegetation shall be permitted in any swale area within the town 3 42886   9991   1o2593 sodding of swale areas  certain parking prohibited  continuous maintenance  certain material prohibited a the owner of any residential property within the town where a residence is under construction shall be required to sod the area between the lot line thereof and the street pavement in a manner to be approved by the building official this approval must be issued and the sod installed prior to the issuance of a certificate of occupancy for the residence upon such lot b the owners of any residential property within the town where a residence or a residential structure is located shall be required to sod the area between the lot line thereof and the street pavement in a manner to be approved by the building official c all sodded swale areas must be continually maintained by the property owner whose property abuts the swale area  the abutting property owner is responsible for the replacement of any sod in the swale area which is dead or which has been removed damaged andor destroyed d parking in swale areas is strictly prohibited except by the abutting property ownerresident andor public service vehicle or except in emergency situations in addition parking any vehicle with a gross weight over six thousand eight hundred 6800 pounds in a swale area in any residential zoning district including the mixeduse districts is strictly prohibited furthermore parking any nonmotorized vehicle including but not limited to boats trailers utility trailers or any other equipment is prohibited in all swale areas and public rightsofway  and no such nonmotorized vehicles shall be parked and displayed for sale lease or rent in these areas even on a temporary basis subsections 19419 and 20 also set forth additional prohibitions against parking on commercially zoned property the fine for these parking violations shall be as set forth in section 196 and may be enforced by the issuance of a parking citation by the town police department or by any other means available these prohibitions against parking in the swale areas shall not apply for the following vehicles under the specific circumstances set forth as follows 1 motor vehicles which are temporarily parked during a period not to exceed eight 8 hours in any twentyfourhour period for the purpose of loading and unloading or vehicles making service calls  and 2 the temporary parking of construction vehicles where construction is underway and for which a currently valid building permit has been issued by the town for display on the premises e no structure building obstruction andor material of any kind whatsoever is permitted within the swale areas in the town other than sodding andor trees and vegetation planted in accordance with section 1733 of the town ordinances with an exception for round cement markers or turf blocks as set forth below in subsection f  however the placement of trees vegetation turf blocks or round cement markers in any swale area located within the town without a permit from the town is strictly prohibited a permit for placement of such regulated materials within the swale area may be obtained from the town building official at no charge f cement pyramids may not be used as swale protectors  however round cement markers are not prohibited when placed a minimum of six 6 inches off street pavement edge spaced at least three 3 feet apart subject to the permit requirement set forth above turf blocks may be used in certain areas of the swale subject to drainage considerations and the issuance of a permit in accordance with a proposed site plan depicting an appropriate swale area depression consistent with requirements listed in section 1742 of the lantana ordinances and approved by the town building official the town building official may deny an application for a permit to install turf blocks in the swale when such proposed installation is determined to be detrimental to surface water drainage in the area the following criteria will be used in the consideration of a swale drainage issue 1 the general topography of the area  2 the elevation of the swale area  3 the proposed swale area depression  and 4 recommendations of the utilities department 4 42886   102593 to the property in this context paving shall include concrete asphalt paving blocks shellrock soil cement and any other pervious or impervious paving material 5 42886 variance the building board of building permit permits issued are contingent upon compliance with the above standards as written any contractor individual firm corporation or agent acting in violation of the abovewritten standards as adopted by the town shall be guilty of a misdemeanor subject to punishment as provided by state law any building permit issued for the construction which has been deemed in violation of any of the
