developer _____ by _____ witness _____ title _____ witness  92887 appendix 13 definitions  for purposes of this chapter the following terms or words shall be used in interpretation of the purpose and intent access the principal means of ingress and egress to a lot from a publicly dedicated rightofway access waterways a waterway which is developed or constructed in conjunction with the division of real estate for the purpose of providing access by water to lots within a subdivision alley a rightofway which affords only a secondary means of access to property abutting thereon and is not intended or used for general traffic circulation applicant the developer or his duly authorized representative who submits to the town managers office a plat and related plans for the purpose of obtaining approval thereof block a parcel of land entirely surrounded by streets streams public or railroad rightsofway parks or other public space or a combination thereof building official the official in charge of the building department or his authorized representative charged with administration and enforcement of the building and zoning codes for the town of lantana centerline a line midway between the rightofway lines or the surveyed and prescribed centerline established by the town engineer which may or may not be the line midway between the existing or proposed rightofway lines contiguous lands are contiguous when they adjoin each other or are separated only for streets ways easements pipelines power lines conduits or rightsofway under ownership of the petitioner or a governmental agency or subdivision or public or private utility culdesac or deadend street a minor street with only one 1 outlet terminating at one 1 end with a circular turnaround grade finished the average level of the finished surface of the ground adjacent to the exterior walls of the building master drainage plan an engineering drawing and a written report outlining the primary and secondary drainage facilities needed for the proper development of a specific area of the town of lantana master plan a drawing which shows the intended division and improvement of real property meeting the requirements of this chapter open space a required exterior open area clear from the ground to the sky devoid of residential and commercial buildings and accessory structures plat final a finished map of a subdivision accurately showing all legal requirements of the state plat law and the requirements of this chapter plat preliminary a copy of the plat in sufficient form to readily compare the plat with the master plan and construction plans plat replat a map depicting the division or subdivision or resubdivision of land into lots blocks parcels tracts or other portions thereof however the same may be designated prepared in accordance with the provisions of this chapter and those of any applicable law andor local ordinance which may be designated to be placed of record in the office of the clerk of the circuit court of palm beach county plat of record a plat which conforms to the requirements of the applicable laws of the state of florida and ordinances of the town which has been accepted by the town and placed in the official records of palm beach county sewerage system central a system for the collection and disposal of sewage in accordance with the approval of requisite state and county agencies from singlefamily multiplefamily commercial industrial institutional or other uses and shall include pipes pumps tanks treatment plants and other appurtenances which comprise the system sewerage onsite disposal system a system designed to serve one 1 unit comprised of pipes tanks and subsurface absorption field or other approved treatment device for handling and disposing of sewage wastes street a strip of land designated for vehicular traffic which affords a principal means of access to a lot or more than one 1 lot whether it is designated as a street highway thoroughfare parkway throughway road boulevard lane place or however designated excluding however alleys and expressways street arterial a street of higher classification than local streets and is used primarily for traffic traveling considerable distance within or area not served by an expressway street collector a street which carries traffic from local streets to arterial streets and includes the principal entrance streets of a subdivision or a development and the streets for circulation within such subdivisions or developments and for purposes of this chapter shall be considered a street of higher classification than a local street street culdesac the term culdesac street shall carry the same meaning as the term culdesac as defined in this section street expressway a street which is used only for the movement of vehicles providing for no vehicular or pedestrian access to abutting property except for street access by grade separation interchanges access to an expressway is not permitted except at authorized and controlled points the acquisition of rightofway for expressways includes the acquisition of access rights thereto street limited access the term limited access street shall carry the same meaning as the term limited access as defined in this section street local a street designed and maintained to provide access to abutting property a local street is of limited continuity and not for street marginal access a street which is parallel and adjacent to an expressway arterial street or limited access street or in the immediate vicinity of such streets and which has its principal purpose of relieving such streets from local service of abutting property by providing protection from conflicts with a marginal access street may also be called a frontage street street minor the term minor street shall carry the same meaning as the term local street  as defined in this section street private any street existing prior to or at the time of adoption of this chapter which has not been dedicated for public use and not accepted for ownership or maintenance by the town after adoption of this chapter streets controlled by a property owners association or condominium or cooperative association as defined by florida law may be retained as private streets by the association as long as such association accepts the obligation for complete control and maintenance street public any street designed to serve more than one property owner which street must be dedicated to the public and be accepted for ownership and maintained by the town unless it is a private street allowed by the terms of this chapter subdivider the term subdivider shall carry the same meaning as the term developer as defined in this section subdivision the division of a parcel of land whether improved or unimproved into two 2 or more contiguous lots or parcels of land designated by reference to the number or symbol of the lot or parcel contained in the plat of such subdivision for the purpose whether immediate or future of transfer of ownership or if the establishment of a new street is involved any division of such parcel the term includes a replat or resubdivision and when appropriate to the text relates to the process of subdividing or to the land subdivided any subdivision of land which creates a new street must be platted surface waters those waters which have been precipitated on the land or forced to the surface in springs and which have then spread over the surface of the ground without being collected into a definite body or channel they appear as puddles sheet or overland and rills and continue to be surface waters until they disappear by infiltration or evaporation or until by overland or vagrant flow they reach welldefined watercourses or standing bodies of water such as lakes or seas water system central the supply of water to serve more than one 1 dwelling commercial industrial institutional or other units which system shall include the water source pipes pumps tanks treatment plants and all other appurtenances to the system water system individual a water source and other appurtenances supplying water to only one 1 dwelling commercial industrial institutional or other unit exh a 71210 footnotes  5  editors note  adopted  repealed ch 175 art xii app 13 in its entirety and enacted new provisions to read as herein set out amended former art ii  18161821 to read as herein set out former art ii pertained to similar subject matter and derived from the  221225 227   9991 cross reference utilities ch 21 state law reference municipalities authorized to levy excise tax on certain public services fs    division 1  electricity fuel oil metered or bottled gas natural or manufactured and water service levy of tax there is hereby levied by the town on each and every sale in the town of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquified petroleum gas or manufactured andor water service a tax based upon the charge made by the seller thereof as follows ten 10 percent utility tax on all charges  which tax shall in every case be paid by the purchaser for the use of the town to the seller of such electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquified petroleum gas or manufactured andor water service at the time of paying the charge therefor to the seller thereof but not less often than monthly  41095   72495 duty of seller to collect and pay tax monthly it shall be the duty of every seller of electricity fuel oil metered or bottled gas natural or manufactured andor water service to collect from the purchaser for the use of the town the tax hereby levied at the time of collecting the selling price charged for each transaction and to report and pay on or before the fifteenth day of each calendar month to the town all such taxes levied and collected during the preceding calendar month it shall be unlawful for any seller to collect the price of any sale of electricity fuel oil metered or bottled gas natural or manufactured andor water service without at the same time collecting the tax hereby levied in respect to such sale unless such seller shall elect to assume and pay such tax without collecting the same from the purchaser any seller failing to collect such tax at the time of collecting the price of any sale where the seller has not elected to assume and pay such tax shall be liable to the town for the amount of such tax in like manner as if the same had been actually paid to the seller and the town shall cause to be brought all suits and actions and to take all proceedings in the name of the town as may be necessary for the recovery of such tax  provided however that the seller shall not be liable for the payment of such tax upon uncollected bills if any purchaser shall fail neglect or refuse to pay to the seller the sellers charge and the tax required the seller shall have the right power and authority to immediately discontinue further service to such purchaser until the tax and the sellers bill shall have been paid in full  41095 records of seller  content  inspection by town each seller of electricity fuel oil metered or bottled gas natural or manufactured andor water service shall keep complete records showing all sales in the town of such commodities or services which records shall show the price charged upon each sale the date thereof and the date of payment therefor and such records shall be kept open for inspection by the duly authorized agents of the town during business hours on all business days and such duly authorized agents of the town shall have the right power and authority to make such transcripts thereof during such times as they may desire  41095 exemption of public agencies and certain telephone services the united states of america state of florida and political subdivisions and agencies thereof are hereby exempted from payment of the taxes levied by this article  41095 computing tax in all cases where the seller of electricity fuel oil metered or bottled gas natural or manufactured andor water service collects the price thereof at monthly periods the tax hereby levied may be computed on the aggregate amount of sales during such period  provided that the amount of tax to be collected shall be the nearest whole cent to the amount computed  41095 wilful default  prohibited it shall be unlawful for any purchaser to wilfully fail or refuse to pay the tax imposed by this article where the seller has not elected to assume and pay such tax  41095 secs 18221835  reserved division 2  telecommunications services levy of tax there is hereby levied and imposed by the town of lantana a public service tax upon purchases within the municipality of telecommunications services as defined in florida statutes which originate and terminate in this state at a rate of seven 7 percent of the total amount charged for any telecommunications service provided within the town or if the location of the telecommunications service provided cannot be determined the total amount billed for such telecommunications service to a telephone or telephone number a telecommunications number or device or a customers billing address located within the town excluding public telephone charges collected on site charges for any foreign exchange service or any private line service except when such services are used or sold as a substitute for any telephone company switched service or dedicated facility by which a telephone company provides a communication path access charges and any customer access line charges paid to a local telephone company however telecommunications services as defined in 5b florida statutes shall be taxed only on the monthly recurring customer service charges excluding variable usage charges  41095 collection a when a seller of telecommunications services renders a bill to the purchaser to cover purchases made during the period of time to which the bill is applicable the amount of public service tax shall be stated separately from governmental charges and taxes and shall not be levied thereon b it shall be the duty of every seller of such telecommunication service in acting as the tax collection medium or agency of the town as established by florida statutes to collect from the purchaser at the time of payment for such service any tax imposed and levied pursuant to the provisions of this article it shall be the responsibility of the sellercollector to remit all such taxes imposed and levied pursuant to the provisions of this article whether or not such taxes were collected from the purchaser by the seller to the town in the event the total amount of tax anticipated to be collected within the town fiscal year exceeds one hundred twentyfive dollars $12500 the sellercollector shall remit the amount of tax collected each month to the town in such case the tax shall be due no later than the first business day after the nineteenth of the month following the month of collection in the event the total amount of tax anticipated to be collected within a town fiscal year does not exceed one hundred twentyfive dollars $12500 the sellercollector may with the written authorization of the town finance director remit the entire amount of tax so collected for that fiscal year to the town annually in such case the tax shall be due no later than the first business day after the nineteenth of the month following the end of such fiscal year any taxes remitted after the dates determined herein shall be considered as delinquent and subject to penalty and interest as determined in subsections c and d hereinbelow c if such collections as described in subsection b hereinabove do not reach the town finance director until after the due date as defined in subsection b hereinabove they will be considered delinquent and shall be subject to penalty interest on the unpaid amount at a rate of one 1 percent per month or any fraction thereof from the due date until such time as the payment is received d it shall be unlawful for any person to continue to provide any telecommunications service with the town who shall fail to collect report and pay over to the town the taxes imposed and levied pursuant to the terms of this article the penalties set forth for willful noncompliance with this article will be in accordance with those imposed by florida statutes  41095 exemptions a the tax imposed by this article shall not apply to purchases of telecommunications services by the government of the town the united states government the state of florida and its political subdivisions or to any recognized church for the use exclusively for church purposes b purchases of local telephone services or other telecommunication service for use in the conduct of telecommunication service for the use in the conduct of telecommunication service for hire or otherwise for resale shall be exempted from the payment of the tax imposed and levied by this part  41095 compensation to seller for the purpose of compensating the seller of telecommunication service the seller shall be allowed one 1 percent of the amount of the tax collected and due to the town in the form of a deduction from the amount collected for remittance the deduction is allowed as compensation for keeping of records and for the collection of and the remitting of the tax  41095 audit and remittance of taxes a the town may at its sole discretion conduct an audit of the sellercollector at such times as it deems necessary to determine the tax imposed and levied has been properly collected and remitted pursuant to the provision of this article each sellercollector of a taxable telecommunications service shall provide to the town upon sixty 60 days notice access to all applicable records for such telecommunications service in an audit the telecommunications service provider shall be liable only for its taxable accounts collected corresponding to the information provided to it by the town any information received by the town or its agent in connection with such audit is confidential and exempt from the provisions of florida statutes 1 pursuant to the provisions of the open government sunset review act in accordance with florida statutes records not located within the municipal limits of the town of lantana must be furnished by the seller to the town or its agent within fourteen 14 days of written demand should the seller fail to comply with the written demand the town of lantana may authorize an agent or officer of the town to conduct an audit at the location where said records are maintained at the sellers expense b it shall be the duty of the sellercollector to remit all such taxes whether collected or not the town reserves the right to bill and collect from the sellercollector for nonremittance of taxes as may be discovered from an audit for twentyfour 24 months prior to the most recent fiscal year end  41095 rules and regulations authorized the town finance director is hereby authorized to promulgate and establish reasonable rules and regulations for the reporting any payment of the tax imposed and levied pursuant to the provisions of this article  41095 secs 18421850  reserved article iii  placement enforcement of liens and special assessments footnotes  3  editors note adopted  added a new art iii  18361847 in order to avoid duplication of section numbers said provisions have been renumbered as  18511862 at the discretion of the editor special assessments  scope a the provisions of this article shall apply to special assessment improvements and sections 1851 may be referred to as the home rule special assessment  improvements may be made or undertaken in accordance with the home rule special assessment the town determines that such improvement should be undertaken and completed and the costs collected in whole or in part as a special assessment the authority granted to the town pursuant to the home rule special assessment be supplemental to other provisions of law including florida statutes and shall not be construed as limiting or being limited by such other provisions of law b special assessments made pursuant to this article shall be levied only for the purposes enumerated in this article and at a rate of assessment based upon the special benefit accruing to the property assessed from such improvements special benefit means generally a benefit which is different in type or degree from benefits provided to the community as a whole the reasonably estimated value of such special benefit must equal or exceed the amount of the assessment for each parcel assessed adoption of the assessment resolution as hereinafter defined and provided shall constitute a legislative finding that these standards have been met  92595 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning assessable area means the area of property that will receive a special benefit from a special assessment improvement assessable front footage means the length of property abutting a special assessment improvement that will receive a special benefit from that improvement assessable value means the value of real property that will receive a special benefit from a special assessment improvement for the purposes of this article the value shall be determined by reference to the assessed value according to the latest final assessment roll prepared by the property appraiser for palm beach county including improvements but without regard to exemptions basis for assessment means the assessable area assessable front footage or assessable value of real property or the equivalent residential units deriving a special benefit from a special assessment improvement as determined by the town in accordance with the provisions of this article when appropriate the town may use a basis other than area front footage value or equivalent residential units in allocating improvement costs among properties specially benefitted by a special assessment improvement including but not limited to the amount of any impact fees or concurrency fees for which the assessed property would be liable and for which the special assessment is levied in lieu thereof cost per assessable unit means the total improvement cost divided by the total basis for assessment of all specially benefitted properties equivalent residential unit means the equivalent residential unit as determined in the intent resolution for those special assessment improvements using equivalent residential units as the basis for assessment improvement means a valuable addition made to real property or an amelioration in its condition for the purposes of this article the term shall include but not be limited to repairs and replacement special assessment improvement means a public works project which adds to or extends the capability of a municipal service including service to another governmental units service area pursuant to an interlocal agreement between the town and such other governmental unit or units and which specially benefits properties adjoining or adjacent to the improvement or properties located within an area in which the special benefits may be determined by increasing the safety utility accessibility or value of the properties involved or by levying a special assessment in lieu of an impact fee concurrency fee or other similar governmental charge levied in connection with the development or improvement of the properties the term includes any improvement of general benefit to the public which the town council determines to serve a proper public purpose and may include improvements conducted jointly with any other public agency or publicly regulated utility street includes but is not limited to a road highway boulevard alley street or other public thoroughfare total improvement cost means the sum of all expenses chargeable to an improvement including all costs incurred from inception to final acceptance including by way of example and not limitation engineering field design and overhead costs  acquisition and construction costs  direct town labor and material costs  general town administrative and overhead costs as a fixed percentage of the other total costs  attorneys fees  and other necessary or incidental expenses such costs may include the cost of construction or reconstruction repair or maintenance the cost of all labor and materials the cost of all lands property rights easements and franchises acquired financing charges interest discount on the sale of special assessment bonds notes or certificates cost of plans and specifications surveys environmental assessments remediation or mitigation surveys of estimates of costs and of revenues cost of engineering and legal services and all other expenses necessary or incident to determining the feasibility or practicability of such construction or reconstruction repair or maintenance administrative expense and such other expense as may be necessary or incident to the improvements and financing authorized  92595 declaration of intent  notice a whenever the town shall decide that a special assessment improvement needs to be accomplished the town council shall by resolution the intent resolution declare the towns intention to have such work performed designating the nature of the work  the location of the work  the part or portion of the cost to be paid by special assessment  the manner in which special assessments shall be made  when such assessments are to be paid  and what part if any shall be apportioned to be paid from other funds of the town or another participating governmental unit such intent resolution shall also describe the lands on which the special assessment is to be levied and it shall be sufficient to describe such lands as all lots and lands adjoining and contiguous or bounding and abutting upon such improvements or specially benefitted thereby such intent resolution shall also state the estimated total improvement costs b at the time of the adoption of the intent resolution there shall be on file with the town clerk an assessment plat showing the area to be assessed together with preliminary plans and specifications and an estimate of the total improvement cost which assessment plat preliminary plans and specifications and estimate shall be open to the inspection of the public c promptly after adoption of the intent resolution the town clerk shall cause said intent resolution to be published once a week for a period of two 2 weeks in a newspaper of general circulation in palm beach county florida  92595 setting assessments for special assessment improvements a determining basis for assessment the town shall determine the total assessable front footage area value equivalent residential units or other assessable unit for each special assessment improvement and shall prepare an assessment roll the preliminary assessment roll in accordance with the method of assessment set out in the intent resolution such preliminary assessment roll shall show the lots and lands to be assessed and after taking into consideration the limitations contained in subsection b of this section the amount of assessment against each lot or parcel b determining assessable cost per lot or parcel the total improvement cost shall be used to develop a cost per assessable unit as defined for the total improvement the assessable unit of each lot or parcel shall be multiplied by the cost per assessable unit to arrive at the total assessment for that lot or parcel  92595 levying special assessment a upon completion of the preliminary assessment roll the town shall by resolution or motion fix a time and place at which the owners of property to be assessed or any other persons interested therein may appear before the town and be heard with respect to the propriety and advisability of making the improvements and funding them with special assessments the cost of the improvement and the amount to be assessed against each property so improved the town clerk shall provide written notice of such hearing to each of the property owners whose property is subject to being assessed such notice shall be provided by first class us mail postage prepaid certified with return receipt requested not less than two 2 days in advance of the hearing in addition notice of the time and place of such hearing shall be given by two 2 publications approximately one 1 week apart in a newspaper of general circulation in palm beach county  the last publication shall appear not less than one 1 week prior to the hearing date  provided however that any mistake in such advertised notice or in any mailed notice shall not void any assessment levied in accordance with the provisions of this article said notice shall contain the date time and place of the hearing describe the area to be improved and advise persons interested that the description of individual properties to be assessed and the amount of the assessment can be ascertained at the office of the town clerk b at such meeting the town shall consider all objections relating to the assessments and shall make a final decision on whether to levy the special assessments thereafter if the decision is to levy the special assessments the town shall equalize or adjust such assessments where justice and right so dictate and shall approve and confirm the assessment roll by resolution the assessment resolution when so equalized and approved a final assessment roll shall be filed in the office of the town clerk and such assessments shall stand confirmed and remain legal valid and binding first liens upon the property against which such assessments are made until paid c a statement of the confirmed assessment shall be provided to each property owner listed on the roll the property owner shall have such time as may be provided in the assessment resolution within which to pay the total assessment d the town shall determine in the assessment resolution when the payment of any special assessment levied pursuant to this article shall commence and the frequency and amount of any scheduled collections of such assessments upon determination of the confirmed assessment roll and the terms and conditions under which such assessments may be prepaid by the property owner e upon completion of the improvement any excess in the special assessment as originally made approved and confirmed over the actual cost of the improvement to be paid by such special assessment shall be credited proportionately against each special assessment against each parcel in the manner set forth in the assessment resolution  92595 collection of payments  installment payments  certificate of indebtedness a notice of assessment  collection promptly after adoption of the assessment resolution a statement of the confirmed assessment shall be provided to each property owner listed on the confirmed roll the special assessments shall bear interest and be payable at the time and in the manner stipulated in the assessment resolution and shall remain liens coequal with the lien of all state county district and municipal taxes other nonad valorem assessments which are duly levied and collected pursuant to the uniform method of levy collection and enforcement of nonad valorem assessments pursuant to florida statutes the uniform method superior in dignity to all other liens titles and claims until paid the town may elect to either collect its own assessment or to utilize the uniform method b installment payments the assessment subject to the interest provided in this section may be satisfied monthly or annual installments as provided for in the assessment resolution with such installment payment period to run not more than twenty 20 years from the completion date of the improvement or such other period as determined in the assessment resolution c certificate issued for failure to pay assessment in the event the town elects to collect its own assessments rather than utilize the uniform method whenever assessments are not paid within the time provided in the assessment resolution a certificate of indebtedness shall be issued for each assessed lot or parcel the certificate shall contain a description of the lot or parcel the amount of the assessment a description of the improvement and shall identify the assessment resolution under which the assessment was made such certificate shall be recorded in the public records of palm beach county and shall constitute a lien coequal with the lien of all state county district and other municipal taxes superior in dignity to all other liens titles and claims until paid and shall bear interest at a rate to be set forth in the assessment resolution d enforcement of certificate upon failure of the property owner to pay any assessment installment due any part thereof or any interest the procedures and remedies of the uniform method shall apply  or if the town has opted not to utilize the uniform method then the town may cause the necessary proceedings to be brought to enforce payment of either the assessment or the certificate issued under section 1856c together with all accrued interest and penalties thereon as a part of such proceeding the town shall be entitled to recover all costs and a reasonable attorneys fee default in the payment of any installment of the assessment or accrued interest shall result in the entire assessment plus interest and penalties thereon becoming immediately due and payable subject to foreclosure such foreclosure proceeding shall be instituted and prosecuted under florida statutes e validity in no event shall the amount or validity of the lien or certificate of indebtedness as provided for by this article be questioned in any direct or collateral proceeding instituted more than thirty 30 days after the issuance of such certificate of indebtedness by the town or such shorter time as may result from the filing of bond validation proceedings  92595 issuance of bonds the town may at any time without an election being held therefor borrow money and issue bonds therefor in anticipation of the collection of unpaid special assessments levied or to be levied for the purpose of paying the cost of special assessment improvements  92595 sanitary sewer extension the town shall have the power to install improve and maintain sanitary sewer lines and facilities storm sewers and drains within the corporate limits of the town and without the corporate limits where provided by general law or special act or by interlocal agreement pursuant thereto benefitting properties shall be assessed by the town for the cost of the improvement to extend the service to their property from the nearest main or sanitary sewer connection  92595 water line extensions the town shall have the power to install improve and maintain water lines and facilities within the corporate limits of the town and without the corporate limits where provided by general law or special act or by interlocal agreement pursuant thereto benefitting properties shall be assessed by the town for the cost of the improvement to extend the service to their property from the nearest water main  92595 special assessments pursuant to interlocal agreements the town is authorized to enter into interlocal agreements pursuant to florida statutes with other local agencies and governmental units in order to implement a special assessment program i where the improvement will be located within the municipal corporate limits of the town but will benefit areas beyond the municipal corporate limits of the town ii where the improvement will be located outside the municipal corporate limits of the town in an area which will not be serviced by the host governmental unit iii where other local agencies or governmental units are to provide funds to pay a portion of the total improvement costs or iv where another local agency or governmental unit is willing to waive an impact fee concurrency fee or similar governmental charge and allow the town to levy a special assessment in lieu thereof to pay all or a portion of the total improvement costs of the proposed improvement to be constructed as part of the special assessment program  92595 specific provisions not a limitation nothing in this article making specific provision and conditions for certain types of improvements to be made by special assessments shall be deemed or construed to limit or affect the power and authority of the town under b of the florida constitution florida statutes and applicable law i to make the same or any other improvement apart from a special assessment or ii to make any other type of improvement by special assessment  92595 irregularities any informality or irregularity in the proceedings in connection with the levy of any special assessment under the provisions of this article shall not affect the validity of the special assessment where the assessment roll has been confirmed by the town by adoption of the assessment resolution the assessment roll as finally approved and confirmed shall be competent and sufficient evidence that the assessment was duly levied that the assessment was duly made and adopted and that all other proceedings adequate to the adoption of the assessment roll were duly had taken and performed as required by this article and no variance from the directions hereunder shall be held material unless it be clearly shown that the party objecting was materially injured thereby  92595 bicycle path within the town  3 in any parking area visibly posted with a no parking sign  4 on the north and south sides of ocean avenue for a distance of two hundred seventy 270 feet east from the vehicle operation and parking a authorization the chief of police andor the town manager shall have the power and either is hereby authorized to regulate the operation and parking of vehicles within the town by the placing of signs signals markers markings and other authorized traffic control devices in the following specified instances 1 designation of areas where parking is prohibited or limited 2 designation of oneway streets stop streets uturns school zones hospital zones quiet zones crosswalks safety zones and truck routes 3 marking off of traffic lanes indicating the flow of traffic 4 closing of streets to vehicular or pedestrian traffic for temporary periods of time 5 regulation of traffic during emergencies notwithstanding other regulations b prima facie evidence the existence of such signs signals markers or marking at any place within the town shall be prima facie evidence that such signs or markers were erected or placed by and at the direction of the chief of police and in accordance with the provisions of this section  111086   72495   responsibility for violations authority of police to immobilize vehicle a authorization to immobilize vehicle the registered owner of any vehicle parked in the town in violation of this chapter shall be liable for the penalties prescribed for any such violation likewise the driver of any motor vehicle parked in violation of this chapter shall be liable for the penalties prescribed for a violation hereof police officers of the town are hereby authorized to attach a device that is capable of immobilizing a motor vehicle so that it cannot be moved under its own power without damage to such motor vehicle if three 3 or more citations alleging the unlawful parking of such motor vehicle have been outstanding for a period of more than sixty 60 days a citation shall be deemed outstanding if it has not been disposed of by payment of a fine or by a final court order or adjudication b procedure to immobilize  notice the immobilizing device shall be attached to the motor vehicle at a place where it is found except that no motor vehicle shall be immobilized within the travel portion of any street or on any portion of any street when immobilization at such place would create a hazard to the public or to traffic on the street at the same time as the immobilizing device is attached to the motor vehicle a notice shall be affixed to the windshield or other prominent place on the motor vehicle stating that the immobilizing device has been so attached cautioning the operator of the motor vehicle not to attempt to operate the motor vehicle while the immobilizing device is still attached and informing the owner or operator of the motor vehicle of the number age and total of fines and charges assessed under the citations for which the motor vehicle is immobilized including the removal charge for removal of the immobilizing device and the location to which he must go in order to pay the fines and charges or deposit a cash bond with the town in lieu thereof should the party desire a hearing and have the immobilizing device removed from the motor vehicle c removal of immobilizing device the immobilizing device shall be removed from the motor vehicle upon payment to the town of the total fines and charges assessed in this section for which the motor vehicle is immobilized or upon deposit with the town clerk of a cash bond to guarantee a court appearance in response to the citations in an amount equal to the fines including the immobilizing device removal the chief of police or his designated police officer may approve the removal of the immobilizing device upon payment of the abovestated fines and charges or upon posting of a cash bond d bond forfeiture for failure to appear in court if a bond is posted with the town as provided in subsections 1942b and c of this the operator does not appear in court in response to the outstanding citations for unlawful parking the bond shall be forfeited to the town as full satisfaction of the outstanding citations the prosecution of the citations shall terminate upon forfeiture of the bond e towing and impoundment the police department may tow or cause to be towed and impound any motor vehicle immobilized under this section if payment for fines and charges or cash bond in lieu thereof have not been paid or posted within twentyfour 24 hours of the attaching of the immobilization device towing shall be in accordance with the provisions set forth in subsection 1944b the notice affixed to the vehicle as noted above in subsection b shall clearly state that there is a twentyfourhour deadline for payment or removal  111086   vehicle owner to pay towing charges when any vehicle found in violation of this chapter has been towed away on the order of a police officer it shall be the duty of the owner thereof to pay the towing charges necessary and reasonably incurred including towing and wrecker charges and storage  111086   towaway zones a it shall be unlawful for any person to park on any street or other public thoroughfare within the town any automobile motorcycle bicycle moped wagon or other motordriven or animaldrawn vehicle except in the spaces designated by appropriate signs markings or white lines or under instructions of a police officer the town manager and chief of police are hereby vested with authority to cause such streets to be properly marked and identified so as to clearly indicate where such vehicles may be parked by device sign or other means whatsoever provided that the same are uniform in design or designation throughout the town the town manager and chief of police are further vested with the authority to fix the hours of permitted parking for any vehicle whether animaldrawn motordriven or manually propelled provided that the time limitations be clearly designated by signs uniform in design throughout the town the parking of any vehicle whether animaldrawn motordriven or manually propelled in any zone or any street in excess of the time designated as aforesaid is hereby declared to be unlawful b the town manager andor chief of police are hereby vested with authority to designate within the town certain restricted parking areas as tow away zones such zones shall be clearly marked by posting of signs indicating restricted parking or no parking and advising that same is a tow away zone the police department and all members thereof are hereby authorized to remove and tow away or have removed andor towed away by a commercial towing service any car or other vehicle illegally parked in a designated tow away zone or in any place where such parked vehicle creates or constitutes a traffic hazard blocks the use of a fire hydrant or obstructs the normal flow of traffic c cars so towed away for illegal parking shall be stored in a safe place and shall be restored to the owner or operator of such vehicle upon payment of the fee assessed for the violation of the parking provisions of the ordinances of the town plus the costs of towing and storage of the vehicle d when a motor vehicle is authorized to be towed away the police department shall keep and maintain a record of the vehicle towed listing the color year of manufacture manufacturers trade name manufacturers series name body style vehicle identification number and license plate year and number displayed on the vehicle the record shall also include the date and the hour of tow location towed from location towed to reason for towing and the name of the officer authorizing the tow  111086   72495   motor vehicles for sale  exceptions it is prohibited to park or display motor vehicles for sale in any zoning district in the town in any public right of way or swale for the purpose of enforcing this section the term motor vehicle shall include all vehicles included within the definition of motor vehicle as set forth in florida statutes but such definition herein shall also include a motorcycle a motorized scooter or a moped as such are also defined in florida statutes additionally residents of private residential premises may sell only one 1 motor vehicle at any particular time subject to the following conditions the motor vehicle is owned by a member of that household the motor vehicle is parked and displayed upon a paved portion of the residential property  and the motor vehicle is not parked nor displayed upon any public rightofway or swale area in the town furthermore no more than three 3 motor vehicles per any consecutive twelve 12 month period may be offered for sale in this manner  42604 hitchhiking  solicitation of rides employment etc prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to stand upon a sidewalk street avenue alley or public highway or grounds within the limits of the town for the purpose of hitchhiking thumbing requesting asking or soliciting a ride employment or business from the operator of any vehicle the provisions hereof shall not be construed to prevent a person from soliciting upon a public highway or a driver of a vehicle from giving a ride where an emergency actually exists not to prevent a person from signaling or requesting transportation from a passenger carrier for the purpose of becoming a passenger for hire    72495 fines  collection agency the fines penalties andor late charges for violations of this chapter shall be set by resolution of the town council and may be amended from time to time as necessary the town reserves the right to turn over all delinquent accounts to a collection agency if not paid within thirty 30 days of the issuance of the initial citation b   62287   72495   4901 secs 1971925  reserved article ii  vehicle impoundment footnotes  2  editors note  adopted oct 9 200 amended art ii in its entirety to read as herein set out former art ii  19261932 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted aug 27 2001 and  adopted sept 23 2002 impoundment of motor vehicles  enumerated misdemeanor offensescontrolled substances prostitution driving under the influence and driving while license suspended cancelled or revoked with knowledge a a motor vehicle shall be subject to seizure and impoundment whenever a police officer has probable cause to believe that the vehicle 1 contains any controlled substance or cannabis as defined in fs ch 893 when such violation is a misdemeanor as defined by florida statutes  or 2 was used in the purchase attempt to purchase sale or attempt to sell such controlled substance or cannabis when such violation is a misdemeanor as defined by florida statutes  or 3 was used to facilitate the commission of an act of prostitution assignation or lewdness as defined in and pursuant to fs  79607 when such violation is a misdemeanor as defined by florida statutes  or 4 was being operated by a person driving under the influence as defined in fs   when such violation is a misdemeanor as defined by florida statutes  or 5 was being operated by a person whose drivers license has been canceled suspended or revoked while knowing of such cancellation suspension or revocation pursuant to fs 322342 when such violation is a misdemeanor as defined by florida statutes b upon seizing the motor vehicle the police officer shall 1 provide for the towing of the vehicle to a townowned or towncontrolled facility or to a facility controlled by the towns towing agent  and 2 notify in writing the person determined to be the owner of the vehicle and any person who is found to be in control of the vehicle at the time of the impoundment of the facts of the impoundment as well as of the right to reclaim the vehicle pursuant to section 1927 and to request a preliminary hearing pursuant to section 1928 3 the notices to be given pursuant to this section shall be provided by hand delivery at the time of the seizure and impoundment of the vehicle except if the vehicle owner is not available to receive such notice or if neither the vehicle owner nor the person in control of the vehicle at the time of its seizure is available to receive such notice then notice shall be mailed to the vehicle owner by certified mail return receipt requested within fortyeight 48 hours of the time of impoundment excluding saturdays sundays and legal holidays 4 this section shall not apply and the vehicle shall not be seized or impounded if a the possession use or sale of the controlled substance andor cannabis is authorized by fs ch 499 or ch 893  or b the vehicle was stolen at the time that it was subject to seizure and impoundment  or c the vehicle was operating as a common carrier at the time it was subject to seizure and impoundment  or d a law enforcement agency has expressed its intent in writing to institute forfeiture proceedings on the vehicle  10906 return of vehicle prior to administrative hearing if the owner of the motor vehicle or hisher agent or authorized representative pays to the town an administrative civil penalty of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 plus the towing and storage costs or posts with the town a bond in the form of a money order or a certified check in the amount of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 plus the towing and storage costs the vehicle shall be released to the owner or hisher agent or authorized representative prior to the administrative hearings held pursuant to section 1928 the payment shall be held by the town pending the administrative hearings if at the preliminary hearing there is a finding of probable cause the town shall retain the collected funds if no probable cause is found the money shall be returned to the person who remitted same  10906 hearings  administrative penalty a preliminary hearing if the owner of the motor vehicle or hisher agent or authorized representative has made a written request for a preliminary hearing then 1 the town shall hold such hearing within ten 10 days of receipt of the written request excluding saturdays sundays and legal holidays before a special magistrate or alternate special magistrate of the town of lantana at the hearing the town shall have the burden to show that there is probable cause to believe that the motor vehicle is subject to impoundment and continued seizure under section 1926 the formal rules of evidence shall not apply at the hearing and hearsay evidence is admissible 2 if after the preliminary hearing the special magistrate or alternate special magistrate determines that there is probable cause to believe that the motor vehicle is subject to impoundment and continued seizure heshe shall order the continued impoundment of the vehicle unless the vehicle owner or hisher agent or authorized representative pays the town an administrative civil penalty of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 plus the towing and storage costs or posts with the town a bond in the form of a money order or a certified check in the amount of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 plus the accumulated costs of towing and storing the vehicle if after the hearing there is a finding of no probable cause the vehicle shall be released forthwith to the owner or hisher agent or authorized representative without the imposition of penalties or fees b final hearing within twenty 20 days of the date that the motor vehicle is seized and impounded pursuant to section 1926 and whether or not a preliminary hearing is requested the town shall mail notice by certified mail return receipt requested to the vehicle owner of record of the date time and location of a final hearing to be conducted pursuant to this subsection the final hearing shall be scheduled and held unless waived by the vehicle owner or continued by order of the special magistrate or alternate special magistrate no later than fortyfive 45 days after the date that the vehicle was seized and impounded the formal rules of evidence will not apply at the final hearing the town shall have the burden to show by a preponderance of the evidence that the vehicle was used as set forth in any of the subsections set forth in subsections 1926a16 if after the hearing a finding is made that the vehicle is subject to impoundment and seizure pursuant to section 1926 and that none of the exceptions set forth in subsection 1926d apply then the special magistrate or alternate special magistrate of the town of lantana shall enter an order finding the owner of record of the vehicle civilly liable to the town for hearing administrative penalty of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 plus towing and storage costs as well as costs of the hearing if after the hearing a finding is made that the town did not meet its burden of proof as set forth in this subsection or that one of the exceptions of subsection 1926d apply the vehicle shall be returned to the owner along with any bond posted in such instance no hearing costs shall be imposed if the vehicle has been returned pursuant to section 1927 and the owner has possession of the vehicle the determination of the final hearing shall be whether the money or bonds remitted to the town shall be retained by the town or returned to the person remitting same if the determination is made that the money or bonds shall be retained by the town hearing costs shall also be assessed  10906 administrative penalty  costs if an administrative penalty towing and storage costs andor hearing costs are imposed pursuant to section 1928 such penalty and costs shall constitute a debt due and owing to the town the vehicles record owners obligation to pay such debt to the town shall be independent of the towns return or release of the vehicle if cash or a cash bond has been posted pursuant to section 1927 the bond shall be applied toward payment of the penalty and costs  10906 return of the vehicle except as provided otherwise in section 1928 an impounded vehicle shall be returned to its record owner or to the person who is legally entitled to possess the vehicle upon hisher payment of the administrative penalty and costs to the town plus any towing and storage fees unless the vehicle has been sold or otherwise disposed of to satisfy a judgment or enforce a lien as provided by law  10906 appeal the owner of the motor vehicle that has been the subject of a seizure and impoundment pursuant to section 1926 1927 and 1928 or the town may appeal the rulings and decisions of the special magistrate or the alternate special magistrate of the town of lantana to the circuit court of the fifteenth judicial circuit of palm beach county within thirty 30 days of the date of the order being appealed the town may charge a reasonable fee for the preparation of the record for purposes of making the appeal  10906 unclaimed vehicles any motor vehicle that is not reclaimed within sixty 60 days from the date of the final order of the special magistrate or alternate special magistrate of the town of lantana regarding that vehicle becomes unclaimed evidence pursuant to fs  6 such unclaimed vehicle shall then be disposed of by the town pursuant to fs    10906 trailers and trailer camps footnotes  1  cross reference   alcoholic beverages definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning recreational vehicles shall mean a vehicle which meets the qualifications of any one of the subsections hereunder 1 motor home a motorized vehicle that can be used for sleeping or living quarters whose dimensions shall not exceed twentyeight 28 feet in length and eight 8 feet in width 2 camper trailer an unmotorized vehicle that can be used for sleeping or living quarters and is designed to be towed by a motorized vehicle or carried on a truck or car body whose dimensions shall not exceed thirtytwo 32 feet in length andor eight 8 feet in width inclusive 3 boat trailer an unmotorized vehicle whose primary purpose is to transport a boat on dry land and is designed to be towed by a motorized vehicle house trailer or mobile home shall mean any vehicle that is used as a sleeping or living quarters whose dimensions exceed eight 8 feet in width regardless of length utility trailer shall mean an unmotorized vehicle whose dimensions shall not exceed twenty 20 feet in length and eight 8 feet in width and is designed to be towed by a motorized vehicle  cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 parking regulations the following parking regulations shall be in full force and effect at all times within the town and shall apply to the specific classes of vehicles 1 house trailers or mobile home all vehicles classified as house trailers or mobile homes are prohibited from being kept maintained or occupied within the limits of the town of lantana unless said vehicle is located within the confines of a duly authorized and licensed trailer court 2 utility trailers all vehicles defined as utility trailers may be parked on private property within the town limits subject to the following regulations a the vehicles may not be used for storage when parked  b the vehicles may be parked only upon the property of the registered owner  c the vehicles must be parked on the rear of the property when not in use 3 recreational vehicles all vehicles meeting the definition of recreational vehicles as set forth above may be kept and maintained upon the property of the registered owner within the limits of lantana subject to the following restrictions a the vehicles may not be used for living quarters at any time b when parked within ten 10 feet of any structure the vehicle shall be maintained in a mobile condition capable of being moved in case of emergency c holding tanks on all such vehicles shall be emptied only at a proper sanitation station  cross reference streets sidewalks and other public places ch 17  traffic and motor vehicles ch 19 environmental control fs ch 403 article i  in general footnotes  2  editors note  repealed art i  211213 in its entirety and enacted new provisions to read as herein set out prior to amendment  211213 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  72ae  and  adopted may 91988 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning average daily flow adf the average daily flow used in determining average usage all consumption data listed in the uniform water & wastewater service policy which shall be adopted as a part of this ordinance shall be considered adf unless otherwise specified base facilities charge the charge to consumers for availability of service for any dwelling unit or commercial use the amount of which shall be determined by resolution of the town council capacity reservation that capacity in the waterwastewater system reserved for the future for which the consumer is required to make reasonable payments based upon the fixed cost of the systems contribution in aid of construction ciac the sum of money andor the value of the property represented by the costs of the water distribution and wastewater collection systems including lift stations constructed or to be constructed by a developer or the owner of a specified property which such developer or owner transfers or agrees to transfer to the town at no cost to the town in order to induce the town to provide utilities service to specified properties consumer installation all facilities ordinarily on the consumers side of the point of delivery developer agreement a written agreement setting forth the terms and conditions under which water and wastewater service is provided such an agreement is required for all development except for single family homes up to and including fourplexes dwelling unit du a single unit or suite designed or intended for single family occupancy including but not limited to one single family house one side of a duplex one apartment one mobile home one unit in a condominium etc equivalent residential unit eru a factor used to convert a given average daily flow adf to the equivalent number of residential connections for this purpose the adf of one eru is estimated to be three hundred fifty 350 gallons per day gpd the number of erus contained in a given adf is determined by dividing that adf by three hundred fifty 350 gpd a residential commercial or industrial consumer may require a larger number of gpd than three hundred fifty 350 depending upon water demand characteristics in any event a single fiveeights inch  58  meter or a single du represents one eru as a minimum when calculating the number of erus all fractional numbers shall be rounded off to the next highest whole number for clarification the following equivalence table shall be utilized when dealing with the following customer classes and meter sizes customer class meter size erus assigned single family 58  or 34 100 single family larger than 34 same as general service see below multifamily 58  or 34 70 general service 58  or 34 100 general service 1 250 general service 1 12 meter 500 general service 2 800 general service 3 1600 general service 4 2500 general service 6 5000 alternatively where historical or engineering data is not available to calculate the appropriate number of erus needed for commercial establishments the following equivalence table may be used 1 a washing machine is equivalent to one 1 fixture or one third  13  of an eru 2 a dishwater is equivalent to one 1 fixture or one third  13  of an eru 3 an inside or outside faucet or one 1 toilet is equivalent to one 1 fixture or one third  13  of an eru 4 an automatic car wash a if water recirculated every three 3 drains is equivalent to one 1 eru b if water not recirculated every one 1 drain is equivalent to one 1 eru fire line a water line provided for the exclusive purpose of supplying fire sprinklers standpipes fire hydrants andor fire hose stations or similar devices on privatelyowned property structures plant capacity charges in addition to meter installation charges all new water and wastewater system users are required to pay a fair share of the capital costs of expansion and improvement incurred new use this capacity charge for new users shall be payable prior to the issuance of a building permit for structures andor additions to existing structures where additional water andor wastewater service is required this charge shall also include the cost of purchasing new capacity from lake worth for wastewater disposal and is also known as an impact fee point of delivery the point where the pipes or meters of the town are connected with the pipes of the consumer unless otherwise indicated the point of delivery shall be the consumers side or discharge side of the water meters that will be utilized for the delivery of water service and the wastewater main or last manhole owned and operated by the town for wastewater service to the consumer the town shall own all pipes and appurtenances to the point of delivery unless otherwise agreed upon the pipes and appurtenances outside the point of delivery shall belong to others readiness to serve charge the charge to recover costs related to maintaining currently unused capacity for the benefit of future customers of the towns water and wastewater systems such readinesstoserve charge shall be calculated based on an equivalency basis eru for carrying costs of related debt service along with operational maintenance and repair related costs as well as capital costs necessary to maintain the unused capacity of the system for the benefit of future customers water only service for those residences and business establishments utilizing potable water which is not returned as sewage the following will apply 1 residential potable water for irrigational purposes is not encouraged however for such use or for consumption with septic tanks or private sewage disposal systems the consumer may have installed a second residential water meter fiveeights inch  58  for irrigational purposes for which no wastewater use shall be charged 2 commercial businesses such as industrial processes garden nurseries car washes etc which do not return the water to the town wastewater system shall have two 2 separate water meters  one 1 to serve the normal domestic usage water and wastewater as applicable and a separate water meter for water only uses and shall be billed accordingly  31102   62314 municipal water and wastewater service a the provision of water from the water supply system from the town to the public as authorized by law shall be referred to in this chapter as water service all persons residing in andor owning property within the corporate limits of the town of lantana must connect to the public water andor wastewater system at such time as the water andor wastewater lines are within one hundred 100 feet of the property line see also section 2190g and section 2191 new wells may only be installed within the town for irrigation purposes or at such locations where the water line is not within one hundred 100 feet of the property line existing wells and septic tanks may be allowed to remain so long as they meet all applicable law but may not be replaced if they should fail unless the water andor wastewater lines are not located within one hundred 100 feet of the property line notwithstanding the above all new commercial industrial andor residential developments must connect to the water and wastewater lines the above noted exceptions relate to existing property and infill single family residences b the collection of sewage and its disposal by the town from the public as authorized by law shall be referred to in this chapter as wastewater service c the town shall own maintain and operate the facilities necessary to provide water service and wastewater service the town retains the right in the discretion of the town council to enter into contracts with private individuals for the extension and modification of the municipal utilities d no person shall connect to the town water supply except as provided in this chapter no water shall be turned on for service in a premises unless all plumbing fixtures and methods of installation comply with all applicable state and local laws e the town shall administer its utilities department in accordance with a uniform water and wastewater service policy which shall be adopted by resolution of the town council such policy shall also contain the forms of developers agreements and refund agreements to be utilized by the town which shall be on file with the clerk and available for inspection at all times during normal business hours developers agreements are required for all development except for single family homes up to and including fourplexes  31102 deposit of certain matter prohibited a it shall be unlawful for any person to place deposit or permit to be deposited in any unsanitary manner on public or private property within the town or in any area under jurisdiction of the town any human or animal excrement garbage or other objectionable waste b it shall be unlawful to discharge wastewater discharges into the towns wastewater facility unless the provisions of this chapter are met c except as otherwise provided it shall be unlawful to construct or maintain any privy any privy vault septic tank cesspool or other facility intended or used for the disposal of wastewater  31102 repair responsibilities the town utility department shall be responsible for all water meter repairs such repairs will include repair of the chuck on the customers side of the meter and will also include all washers or seats unless the meter has been tampered with by the customer see section 215 for charges related to repair of water meters if same have been altered or tampered with by the customer the town is responsible for all repairs to the actual wastewater main andor water main itself regardless of where it is located and for all repairs to all laterals up to the property line andor easement boundary  however the customers are responsible for all repairs laterals on their own property or remainder of property beyond the easement boundary customers are responsible for presenting proof to the town that repairs are necessary with the areas assumed as the responsibility of the town any repair andor new construction to be accomplished on the customers property or on townowned property rightsofway easements etc must be permitted by the town building department  31102 water meters and curb stops  reading  tampering a all premises using the towns water supply must be equipped with an adequate water meter all water meters shall be read by an employee of the town on a monthly basis the customer shall be responsible to pay for all water consumption as indicated by his meter should a customer believe a leak in the system has resulted in an unfair charge the customer may contact the town and request an informal hearing in accordance with section 2139 of this chapter b it shall be unlawful for any person not authorized by the town to tamper with alter or damage any meter or curb stop should the town discover that a meter or curb stop has been tampered with damaged or altered in any manner whatsoever due to any cause whatsoever other than ordinary wear and tear the town will repair the meter or curb stop at the expense of the customer who shall be deemed responsible for the costs of all labor and materials necessary to repair the damage such costs shall be added to the customers regular utility bill should the customer believe the repair has resulted in an unfair charge the customer may contact the town and request an informal hearing in accordance with section 2139 of this chapter  31102 developer installed lines or facilities a whenever any person desires to construct or extend any water or wastewater lines or facilities the person or persons desiring to construct or extend such lines or facilities shall first obtain from the town a written permit and may be required to enter into a developers agreement as described in section 212e any such construction or extension of such lines or facilities shall be done so as to meet approval of the town and the towns specifications as to the depth and location of such lines andor facilities the size and dimension of pipes the quality and quantity of materials and the method of construction b the developer of a tract of land after approval of plan by the town and other appropriate agencies shall at his expense install the required distribution and collection mains and appurtenant facilities to connect the development to the towns system the developer shall also at his own expense after approval by the town and all appropriate agencies install all distribution and collection lines and appurtenant facilities within the said development upon acceptance of such installation by the town all facilities shall be deeded to and shall become the property of the town procedure outlined in section 217 hereinbelow c should the town require oversized lines or facilities beyond the requirements to serve the developer the town shall reimburse developer only for the difference in the cost of the pipes or facilities requested by the town by refundable advances or otherwise  31102 relinquishment of lines or facilities to town when construction has been completed the relinquishment of the newly constructed lines or facilities to the town shall be in accordance with the following procedures 1 by instrument acceptable to the town the developer shall submit to the town the following a bill of sale for the lines  b no lien affidavit  c verification of final costs  d legal description  e copy of recorded plat if a new subdivision or if an existing subdivision is redivided  f contractual guarantees from suppliers along with applicable dates  g uptodate list of customers andor owners of individual lots  and h recorded easements granting right of access to lines within private property with title policy or other evidence of title regarding same 2 absent an express written waiver executed and signed by authorized agents of the town the town will not render service nor accept responsibility for maintenance of lines or facilities until the documentation as set forth in section 2171 hereinabove has been received and accepted by the town 3 no plat will be certified by the town for final recording until the documentation required in section 2171 hereinabove has been completed and acceptable with the exception of a copy of the recorded plat  31102 refundable advances the town may require in addition to the rates fees and charges duly adopted by resolution of the town council a refundable advance in cash or in property by developers or consumers to defray the cost of any offsite extension of water andor wastewater mains and appurtenant facilities necessary to connect the developers or consumers property with the then terminus of the towns water andor wastewater facilities such developers or consumers shall always be responsible for and shall not be refunded their hydraulic share of the cost of such offsite water and wastewater facilities however in instances in which a developer or consumer may be required to advance the construction funds applicable for other undeveloped property in order that offsite facilities may be constructed to serve the developers or consumers property amounts expended by such developer or consumer over and above their hydraulic share and other applicable rates fees and charges are subject to refund to such developer or consumer in accordance with the terms and conditions of a refunding agreement executed between such developer or consumer and the town of lantana in the format as described in section 212e the refund agreement shall be subject to negotiation between the town and such developer or consumer in no event shall such developer or consumer recover an amount greater than the costs of such improvement contemplated herein and the town shall not include any interest upon the refund of such developers or consumers advance the town will make refunds to such developers or consumers entitled to refundable advances on a prorata basis as others tie into the utility system and pay offsite charges to the town in no event shall the town be required to refund more funds to a developer or consumer than the town has collected from others refunds made by the town to such developers or consumers shall be made as set forth within the refunding agreement furthermore and notwithstanding any other provision of this section the town shall limit the life within the terms of such refunding agreement to a term of five 5 years after which time any portion of the refund made to such developer or consumer by the terms and conditions of the refund agreement will become the property of the town and such refund agreement shall be void wastewater service  deposit a any person desiring to use water andor wastewater services supplied by the town shall file a written application describing the property where the service shall be installed the size of connection desired and all other pertinent information b all materials and labor used exclusive of meter when making any connection shall be charged at cost to the person applying for the service c each developer owner builder or other person who purchases land or realty for the purpose of development shall be responsible for the design and installation of the complete utility system within their development project building or other structure as necessary to connect same to the towns system complete utility system shall include all component parts of a wastewater collection system or water distribution system and appurtenant facilities as shown upon the approved design drawings of such development project building or other structure d whenever any person desires to secure service beyond the present limits of the towns water or wastewater system and for such purpose they have water or wastewater lines andor facilities constructed or otherwise extended to the town all rights easements permits and privileges which are necessary for the rendering of such service f applicants for such service shall be required to deposit with the town clerk the deposit fee established by the most recent fees and charges resolution adopted by the town council a receipt will be given for the amount by the town clerk such deposit will be refunded when it is requested that service be discontinued unless such deposit has been applied to the customers account due to delinquency the town council by resolution may authorize an additional deposit by persons whose accounts are repeatedly delinquent  31102 water and wastewater rates and charges a the town shall by resolution establish reasonable rates to be charged the consumers of the water and wastewater service reasonable classifications of consumers may be established so long as the classifications are not arbitrary or discriminatory and so long as the rates apply similarly to all within a class under like conditions service provided to consumers outside the town corporate boundaries shall be charged a surcharge in accordance with fs ch 180 b the water rates and charges in the town as well as the wastewater rates and charges in the town shall be established and amended as necessary from time to time by resolution of the town council in addition to water and wastewater rates and charges this service charge resolution shall also include related fees and charges such as fees to turn water service on and off  minimum charge for residential and commercial erus  rates for new andor additional installation  deposit amounts for new service  surcharge deposit for delinquent customers  amount charged for late fees  a readinesstoserve charge  plant capacity charges  a water conservation charge for all gallons of usage in excess of the authorized gallons per month and any other fees or charges necessary to implement the provisions of this chapter c all rates established by the fees and charges resolution shall be adjusted on an annual basis by an amount equal to one hundred 100 percent of the allurban consumer price index cpi the index as of may shall be the basis for the annual adjustment which shall be effective october 1 of each year the maximum cpi increase shall be limited to ten 10 percent  31102   62314 rates to meet certain costs the rates charged by
